description:
Elotes- 7 dollars for a cob of corn but SO GOOD!!

I would uber here in a jiffy whenever I crave for an elotes.

I've also tried their tacos and quesadilla. Their portions are huge! I love the fact we were able to mix the type of taco so I was able to try the duck taco and tempera taco ( interesting types!). It was delicious!

The chicken quesadilla was huge, but also was stuffed with so many items that it made it a bit overwhelming. I wasn't quite sure what I was eating when I took a bite.

Overall, I love their tacos and ELOTES! Parking here is really easy to find, and though the store is small, we were always able to get a seat immediately!
author: Josie H.

description:
Chill Mexican food spot in Potrero.

Never actually sat down for food here, however, I order takeout from them quite often. Their claim to fame is organic ingredients for mexican food, and that's reflected in their price. They're like the Whole Foods of mexican food.

I'm not one for organic food, but this place is high quality and close by. If I lived in the mission, and I felt like more of a tex-mex vibe, I would come here. Otherwise, their burritos and tacos are nothing like the mission style I have become accustomed to. One dish I would recommend: their rustic shrimp enchiladas ($20 after tax). It's a heaping mess, but the shrimp is super tasty and the cabbage on top is cut with lime juice, making the whole amalgamation one of my favorite things to order.

Burritos are average, in fact, probably a little below. I wished they wrapped them a little tighter, because sometimes they're a little wieldy to handle. The duck burrito is also not that great, since they take the mexican vibe and add ... tamarind sauce? It becomes kind of watery and the flavor is not as focused. Stick to the basics if you want a burrito.
author: Albert C.

description:
This place is very small, but I was able to get a seat on Friday at lunch around 1:30 without a reservation.  Also, it has a few nice outside seats if you like to eat outside.  

I was recommended the quesadilla, but since I am not familiar with Mexican cuisine, I didn't know what that was. But I ordered it.  It looks like tacos, but the taste is different.  I can't describe the taste, but it had cheese.  It was so tasty.
author: St Giles I.

description:
Cute and small little neighborhood Mexican restaurant with a variety of dishes to choose from to suit your taste! 

Why I was here // National fajita day was yesterday - so I told my bf I was feeling like Mexican food (even though I didn't end up getting fajitas...lol) Came for dinner on a Saturday night and we were able to get seated for a party of 2. 

Atmosphere // Cozy and intimate. My bf and I sat in the outside patio area which was nice because you can see people walking their adorable dogs and also the heat lamp was nice! 

Service // lovely! Checked up on us every once in awhile and the food came out in a timely manner. 

Food // 
-Drink // watermelon aqua fresca // on the sweeter side, but definitely hit the spot for a refreshing beverage! 
-Food // Rustic shrimp enchilada // 18.00 // not really what I was expecting as it was a deconstructed enchilada. The shrimp were decent sized and perfectly cooked spread around the hot plate with loads of oozing cheese and tortilla. They were a bit scant with the beans and I felt like the sauce was just ok for me. 

Overall // This place is conveniently located in my neighborhood but it's on the pricier side. If you are feeling like a good burrito/taco- there are places in mission that do a great job, but if you are looking for something more unique, maybe give this place a try?
author: Emily T.

description:
This is my favorite burrito place in the world! Better than the one in Hayes Valley. I love their ceviche, fish tacos, and everything else on the menu. Food is filling and delicious. I wonder why other taco places are so popular when their tacos are so obviously the best in the city.

The best!!
author: Andrea T.

description:
Omg!  This place is such a little gem.

It is such a small place, but on Saturday lunch around 1pm, we were quickly seated without reservation. 

I was recommended to get the shrimp enchilada here.  For me not being particularly a shrimp person I was hesitated, but to be honest This dish blew my mind! 
I wasn't expecting anything like this. When I first had a bite of shrimp, I was like ok it's just shrimp and maybe I should've got a pulled pork or slow cooked carne asada. When I dug a little and tasted the sauce, I was like mmmm? MMMMMM!! What is this? Is this loaded with butter or what makes it taste like this?? I was confused but with a joy and happiness explosion in my mouth. I really love they mount the dish with thin sliced cabbages. It goes really well and add the texture to the already well polished dish. 

Another high point is They service sangria from Cha cha cha, which I am a huge fan of. I just wish their version wasnt so watered down because sangria from Cha x3 is always on point. But it was still flavored good. Maybe I'll ask for it without ice next time. 

There are a bunch of other things I wanted to get on the menu. I am definitely coming back!
author: Cartman P.

description:
This place is tiny! Come early or with patience :) It's worth the wait. I heard the burritos are amazing but I was in the mood for duck confit tacos. Very tasty and flavorful and a lot of duck confit. My friends got fajitas and a shrimp dish. I had a bite of a the steak fajitas and they were delicious! 

If you're into churros, don't forget to order some at the end of the meal! I wasn't a fan or either sauce, but they were delicious plane.

Bottom line: Lots of options at this restaurant! Stop by and dine on something delicious.
author: Kim P.

description:
I am in love with this place!  I guess you can consider this spot a hole in a wall.  It's super small with limited tables.  They cook everyone's food to order.  And I love their sangria which is inspired by cha cha cha.  

My favorite?  The burrito mojado with coloradito sauce.  Basically a giant burrito topped with red sauce.  It's definitely enough for 2 meals.  Everything is super fresh and I love that they use la Palma's tortillas.  Those are by far my favorite tortillas in the city.  The burrito is super packed, served piping hot...and extremely addictive.  

Get a side of guac with your chips too.  Super fresh and a perfect complement.  

Dessert?  The churros.  Our server recommended it and did not disappoint!  They also have a location in Hayes valley.  5 stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
Love love love papito. Every Saturday at my work we order take-out and Papito is our constant go to spot. 

I have had the shrimp burrito, veggie quesadilla, carne asada burrito and the fish tacos - Everything is amazing!! 

My co-workers die for the papito salad with chicken and the fish burrito! The tacos are great but you get a LOT more food if you order a quesadilla or super burrito so if your'e hungry go for one of those. The quesadillas are STUFFED to the brim with a lot of delicious things, please note:  this is not your basic cheese and tortilla type of place.

We always ask for extra red salsa because it's sooooo good. Thanks papito for always making us happy customers! 

I also definitely recommend eating in for lunch, the restaurant is really cute and small - cafe style and the outside seating is perfect for a nice day in potrero hill!
author: Molli W.

description: Cozy little spot with some good Mexican food. The Sopa was great as were the churros and street corn. There was a considerable wait due to the size and popularity of the place. They ran out of almost all their beers- Corona was it, but at least they had that!
author: Ondrea B.

description:
I went to this place on a weekend for dinner with my friends.

This is a small Mexican eatery/restaurant in San Francisco with limited seating both indoors as well as outdoors.
Hence, finding a seat especially on the weekends can be a little time consuming.

They offer chips with homemade guacamole, salsa and two other sauces at the beginning.
Guacamole with cheese and chips is a treat to start with.

We ordered the following:
1) El vegetariano Taco
This dish was a combination of poblano peppers rajas, corn, queso fresco, salsa verde and onions.
The spices were perfectly added which made the dish even better.
This dish was amazing to taste.

2)  Veggie Quesadillas
This plate was a combination of wild mushrooms, poblano peppers rajas, corn, queso fresco, salsa verde (organic spinach tortilla).
These quesadillas are definitely the best quesadillas I have eaten in the bay area.
The spices make them different than the ordinary quesadillas that are offered in many other Mexican places.
This dish is definitely worth a try and the best of the lot for vegatarians.

3) Enchilada Rojas with vegetables
A typical Mexican styled enchilada with a choice of coloradito sauce or salsa verde, sour cream, chihuahua cheese, black beans, spanish rice.
This dish was average in taste.

4) Watermelon Juice
Freshly made watermelon juice which was amazing to drink.

The only pitfall about this restaurant are their prices.
The food is an absolute treat, no doubt about that but the price is higher too.

Will definitely visit this place again.
author: Pratham V.

description:
Omg their tacos are sooo good. Order them without sour cream for a more authentic flavour experience. FYI default has sour cream.

So we cheated. We were having drinks at Mochica (right around the corner) and they said they wouldn't be able to quickly get us food (we had 25 minutes before our play started). Walked to Papito and got a couple tacos. Mmmmm!! We lurved them so hard!

Decor at Papito is cute. It's a small place for sure but it's got a great vibe happening in there.

Service was really good. The lady who was helping me out was super nice. She was singlehandedly managing the whole place, customer-wise, and doing a great job at it.

We ordered to go and got our food in about ten minutes. Pretty fast! 

I definitely want to return and check out some more of the items on the menu here... argh, I'm starting to drool as I write this and reminisce on the flavors... ;)
author: Alex G.

description: This is one of the best Mexican spots in the city, hands down. The restaurant is small and not your typical taqueria. We sat at the bar and had an awesome meal. The super burrito was amazing!! Will definitely be coming again!! An absolute must if you're on a tour of taquerias in San Francisco!
author: Robert L.

description:
If you're in the neighborhood and you're desperate for Mexican food this place is for you. Don't get a to go order unless you don't mind soggy food. The food was so soggy it was almost inedible. The food was breaking apart from all the moisture. 

The lady charging me was standoffish. She didn't even let me know that the food will be ready shortly. She charged my card and just turned around and ignored me. My food was ready and hanging there till the other gentleman asked if I needed help. Couldn't she just hand me my food since it was ready? 

Also found a tiny piece of hair inside the box and no it wasn't mine. 

Papito in Hayes is 100x better than this place.
author: Yerm I.

description:
I want to 5 star this place for its rustic shrimp enchilada which blew my mind ($18) but I'm knocking off a star for its service:

Small restaurant with good food means long waits, forgotten requests, and irritation. I came in and after seeing 4 names ahead of me and a full house, I decided to order take-out. The solo waitress was on the phone, rushing here and there and it took ~20 minutes before she took my order. I had to stand awkwardly by the kitchen which was literally ~3x5ft or smaller (they had 2 chefs and 1 dish washer). I asked for a duck confit regular burrito (the super burrito included avocado and sour cream I think) and she confirmed by asking 'regular burrito?' and I nodded. Turns out, she wrote down 'regular burrito' and no duck confit... What did she think I was doing for the first 3 syllables of my order? I probably should have confirmed back about the duck confit/checked my receipt but it was dark, I was hangry and I thought she wrote it down as I was speaking. 

Afterwards, she gave us the check but forgot to take the receipt and was so busy the entire time that we just held the receipt, pen, and everything (basically right in front of her) until we picked up our order ~30 minutes later. 

Like I said, the rustic shrimp was amazing--flavors came together, great dynamic, good choice of cheese, but the burrito was the sum of its parts and not mind-blowing. That, on top of the unpleasant wait, made this experience rather disappointing. They also gave me 1 sauce for the chips even though they were packaging 3 different sauces (?)
author: Lydia Z.

description:
3.5 

Its small, cute, cozy; nestled on my fav street in Potrero Hill. One thing to note right away is that this is not straight up Mexican and you wont get hearty taqueria dishes here. They have hamburgers/fries on the menu so don't be alarmed. With that said the menu has good options. The one thing that really bothered me was that they used fried chicken instead of grilled in a lot of their dishes (not my thing but may be yours?) . I always am in search of a good Mexican restaurant (not taqueria, although those are very near and dear to my heart) that serves an amazing plate of  enchiladas. I haven't found many in SF so I had been eyeing Papito for a while because they had two types of enchiladas on their menu. 

What I got: Guac, decent but def not super fresh table side made guac , but hard to complain about guac. Verde enchiladas with chicken, this dish actually had shredded chicken but I wish i got it without . I wasn't a fan of the taste of the chicken. The verde sauce was great!! I'd prob get this again but vegetarian instead and maybe less cheese bc it was really smothered. 

They have some outdoor seating which would be great on a nice day. I'd def come back for some small bites, and the enchiladas til i find my go-to in SF.
author: Hetal P.

description: Super burrito is pricey, but hard to beat.  I'm not sure if you've really lived until you've taken down their fried chicken super burrito.  Great quality ingredients make for delicious food.  Haven't been disappointed yet...
author: Brian G.

description: Excellent and friendly service. Food is fresh and flavorful! Small but warm inviting environment
author: Gabby R.

description: Our new favorite place to grab guacamole and chips, sangria (Cha Cha Cha style) and burritos. The service is great. Omg we just tried the churros that are made fresh to order-it comes with white chocolate and regular chocolate sauce and the churros are filled with a custard, crunchy on the outside and gooey on the inside. If you come during busy hours there will be a wait. You can dine inside, on the bar or outside so dogs are welcome!
author: Guisela L.

description: Good solid Mexican food! Tiny location but they kindly kept an eagle eye out for people ending their meals and sat us as soon as possible. Huge margaritas as well!!
author: Zoë N.

description: This place is great!! Great service and delicious tacos.  The fish taco was cooked to perfection and the veggie taco has a fresh twist on tacos with kale, wild mushrooms, corn, poblano peppers, and black beans.
author: Lisa G.

description:
Haven't been here in a while, as I've moved out of the city. Love the food.. no place better!!! But, there's a new chick bartending and she's literally walked past me for 10 minutes, made eye contact, yet hasn't said hello or taken my drink order. I can see multiple people at the bar experiencing the same frustration as she tends to to-go orders. Hoping this review gets her a conversation from the management about the importance of  saying "hello", even if it has to be followed up with "we're really busy, but I'll be right with you". 

Happy to update this review to 5 stars once the service is up to par with the food! 

I will still be back :)
author: James H.

description:
Papito is a tiny, tiny restaurant in Potrero Hill--don't expect much room or great seating when you're here. The service was also quite inattentive, and we sometimes had to ask multiple times to get the things we wanted. All that being said, though, the food here is really tasty and a good value for the price! I came for dinner on a Friday with a group of three--we sat together at the bar and were started with chips and salsa. The menu here looks quite simple--small plates, tacos, burritos, and mains--with the same selection of meats being repeated for the various categories.

We started with the Ensalada Papito, a beautifully dressed salad of romaine lettuce, cucumber, and avocado. Every piece of vegetation on the salad was covered perfectly with a delicious, savory cilantro dressing--there was great crunch from the tortilla strips as well! We had the steak fajitas, which came on a sizzling plate--the thin pieces of steak were marinated perfectly (great, hearty flavor) and were grilled with bell peppers and onions. There were also tortillas and rice/beans on the side, but the meat was definitely the star of the show. We also had the chicken enchiladas, which came in a delicious, decadent tomato sauce, and the carnitas tacos, which came with amazingly juicy pork (not at all too fatty) and a nice slaw on top as well.

Overall, some of the tastiest Mexican food I've had in a while--though the atmosphere and service are nothing to speak of, the great food was certainly well worth the visit!
author: David K.

description: I resisted going here for a long time -- what would a French guy know about Mexican food?  Finally got dragged here by my husband, and fell in love with the Pozole.  Just enough spicy, perfect tender pork, crunchy veggies, and a couple of slices of avocado.  It's sooo good!  My daughter always gets the nachos, and those are really good as well.  Good sangria, great service.
author: Sharone F.

description:
I brought a friend from out of town and was surprised by how small the place is, so the ambiance was more casual than I was hoping for. A few tables inside, a few outside, and the kitchen is in plain sight with strong smells of whatever's cooking. 

I was debating between the super burrito (minus sour cream + sauteed veggies) or the veggie quesadilla. The super burrito comes with guacamole, which swayed my decision. Thankfully, my roomie ordered the veggie quesadilla, so I still got to try it. I'm disappointed to report that while the super burrito is indeed super in size, it wasn't super in taste. There wasn't much guac inside. Like seriously, the thing was the length of my forearm (WHO needs this much food?!), and yet I could barely see a thin spread of avocado in it. It was mostly filled with onions, very few mushrooms or kale. 

The veggie quesadilla was better without all that rice and beans, but nothing special. My friend did enjoy his duck confit quesadilla, so maybe their vegetarian options are just not as good. 

They're apparently known for sangria and churros, and since I live close by, I'll probably give them a second chance.
author: Karen S.

description: Look, im all for value but a burrito shouldn't be so big, that it falls apart in your hands. Other than the that, it's delicious, you just have to eat it with a knife fork. But the whole purpose of a burrito is because I don't have both hands free.
author: Malcolm N.

description:
I have had several bad customer service moments that I finally have to say something. 

1. Once I ate in and the guy charging us decided to create his own pricing, good that I looked at the menu for pricing. Funny that he knew what he was doing when brought to his attention. 

2. I called and they left me on hold for 15 minutes so I hung up.

3. Called again on another day and on hold for a long time. This time I waited and when this guy answers he start making jokes about what my wife was ordering, so I hung up, again.

4.This time when picking up an order they just ignored my daughter until she had to say something which is unacceptable. Lucky for them that I was not ther hie because I would have given them a few choice words and would have not taken the food. 
Whoever is the owner of this establishment should start looking into these irresponsible workers.
author: E V.

description:
You guys. 

I'm obsessed with this place. 

Papito is an excellent casual but sit-down Mexican restaurant. In my book, it blows Nopalito, Padrecito, Tacolicious, and just about any other Taco-rendition out of the water. The calamari, tacos, and quesadillas are to die for. My personal favorite was the fried chicken quesadilla - so unique but not so weird that it doesn't satisfy my Mexican food craving. We ordered a carafe of Mango Margaritas. It didn't turn out to be any different than ordering for separate mango margaritas (price and quantity) so our waiter adjusted the price and also gave us extra drinks on the house. Do I need to state the obvious? I love Papito!
author: Nicole J.

description:
We had the coronarita, elite asada, and the super burrito, it was great! The beef and spice was perfect. One of my favorite Mexican foods in the city! 

Cannot wait to come back.
author: Eric A.

description:
Really loved the food. One of the best Mexican restaurants 
 in SF.
The Burrito was one the of best here. There was an element of surprise in the Burrito
author: Guneet M.

description: Best Mexican food in the city. Hands down. Nothing comes close. I personally think the tacos and the burritos are the best deals here. Big portions and high quality ingredients. Gotta have em once a week at least.
author: HW Y.

description: Great place! The tacos are incredible. Please get the guacamole it is SO fresh! Also they handed out free shots at the end of the night... everyone loves that! The wine margarita is also so strong! So if you like a good drink, thats your drink! Such a great hole in the wall place for a mid day dinner. Try it out and you wont be dissapointed
author: Marissa P.

description: I only ordered an al pastor burrito to go and it was awesome! Best of all, they treated me with extreme hospitality. I am very much looking forward to dining in here.
author: Sonny M.

description: Cute little Mexican place, with delicious food that are reasonably priced. We ordered the taco salad and streets tacos (carnitas) to share. Probably one of the best streets tacos I've had anywhere. Plus this huge margarita was only $8! Great ambiance with excellent service. Our servers were very friendly and the food came out quite fast.
author: Anh D.

description: Check your food carefully if you do carry out. I got a shrimp burrito, when I ordered chicken. Glad I didn't bite into it cuz I'm allergic to shrimp.
author: David B.

description:
Love Papito - the Hawaiian fish tacos are divine, the staff always warm and friendly. My only BIG complaint is the restroom - it's kind of gross w all the cleaning equipment there and other accessories. For God's sake please retire that stuff elsewhere! Would love to have it cleaned up w a bit of character added (a flower in vase, artwork, whatever!?).

Tx.
author: Eric K.

description: Lots to like here! Great ingredients! My go to is a fried chicken burrito, but I don't think I've ever had a bad dish and been coming for years.
author: Cat M.

description:
I ate there today around 11 am it was my first time.  The waiter was so friendly and provided excellent service.  We were the first at the restaurant.  I had the nachos which was delicious but I felt it didn't have enough nachos chips and for $15.00 I felt there should have been a full plate of Food.  I had to keep adding chips from the free chip bowl provided earlier. 
But over all 4 STARS if my plate would have bigger and more chips would have been added they would have gotten 5 STARS
author: Jay S.

description: The pozole was slightly smoky and delicious.  Bomb ceviche.  Refreshing watermelon agua Fresca.
author: John W.

description:
While in the city last night enjoying SF beer week festivities, my boyfriend and I found ourselves at a brewery that didn't serve food. So we decided to order delivery from Papito through Caviar's delivery service. (This review is based solely on the food).  I ordered a super burrito, which came with Spanish rice, black beans, pico de gallo, monterey jack cheese, guacamole, and sour cream, and I paid extra to add shrimp inside. My boyfriend also ordered a super burrito, but opted to add the duck confit in his. We also ordered the homemade guacamole to share. 

The food arrived pretty quickly, and it was hot and fresh upon arrival. The guacamole was good, but we both agreed that it was not worth the $10 we paid for it. We were also disappointed by the tortilla chips that came with it, as they seemed store bought rather than made in house. So far, we were pretty underwhelmed. 

We moved onto the burritos, which my boyfriend even commented, "looked like a small baby." They were pretty large, and definitely well-stuffed. My boyfriend loved his duck confit burrito. My camarones burrito was good too, but could have used more shrimp. Overall though, we were pleased with the food, and would order from Papito again.
author: Danielle M.

description: The corn on the cob, watermelon drink is bomb. I had the chickdn combo plate and tried the chicken quesadilla and both good. My bf and daughter had the super burrito and they enjoyed it. It was very big.
author: Marie C.

description:
Food was great, but seemed overpriced for what it's worth.

Started off with the "Queso fundido", bowl of baked bean and cheese and I'll say it was CHEESY AF. Once you try this appetizer, you will hope you do not have any more cheese in any of your already ordered items (which very likely has cheese in it) haha. It's an intense amount of rich cheese in a small bowl that get's you thinking "OH LAWD, SO CHEESY BUT SO GOOD, CAN'T STOP WON'T STOP EATING IT". BEWARE, this appetizer is extremely heavy and filling. It make look like a small bowl, but it did good work when shared between 2 people and I'm talking about the first appetizer we got. We still had 2 entrees coming... it was great to try, would not get again the $10 price tag!

Before I get to the entree, I want to say that their selection of 3 salsas are great, all with different tastes, flavors, and spiciness levels! You'll definitely find 1 or more that you'll enjoy throughout the meal!

The "Papito's combo" was a pretty decent meal with choice of meat and the basic beans and sides. It was good, not $14 good? Seemed pretty basic to me... The "Rustic shrimp enchilada" was muuuuuch better, but I don't know if I want to pay $18 for it... Had a decent amount of sauce on top, but not enough to smother the enchilada. Lots of good flavor and texture in this meal.

I was happy to try out this place, but I can't justify the food vs price here. It's good, but not great or amazing...
author: Andrew S.

description:
Aye yaya... What a cool little joint in the hill...Super tiny place that is full of heart and personality. I think there are only like 5 or 6 2 top tables total, plus 4 or 5 2 tops outside. Everyone is super nice and friendly (face it, you are all crammed together, play nice). Service was great. Like you are in a little cantina with family serving you. We started with the Papito Tempura shrimp with guacamole, chipotle remoulade, green cabbage slaw, pico de gallo. It's a lot to put on a little street taco tortilla. But, man were they good!
Then we had the Papito's Combo with pork. and the Enmolada (braised chicken with oaxacan mole, sour cream, monterey jack cheese, black beans, spanish rice, and pickled red onions).
Both of these dishes were outstanding!  The flavors are awesome.
I totally recommend coming to Papito's for lunch, dinner, snack, whatever....
author: Greg S.

description:
VIBE: Small & Casual
WHY: The flavors!

I love this spot. No matter what, I'm always happy with what I get. The duck tacos, chicken emolada and their al pastor quesadilla are my favorites. The shrimp enchiladas are also delicious. We usually go during "off times" because this place is so tiny, but if you're in the neighborhood and looking for some great mexican food, look no further! They also make a mean espresso & have fun servers. They keep me coming back...
author: Eve D.

description: To celebrate my one year anniversary of living in California I'm taking a mini-retreat in the city (I currently live in the East Bay) for the weekend in Potrero Hill. This place is right next to where I'm staying and caught my eye. Sat outside at a cute table on a lovely Friday evening and ordered queso fundido with chorizo (my go to) and it was the best presentation I've had, not to mention delicious. Service was excellent and my server was funny and savvy. I strike up a conversation with the women dining next to me and next thing you know we are all served a mini serving of agave wine with lime- what a sweet treat! When I left I was thanked with a smile- genuinely great service. And the guys in the kitchen seem to be having a blast, which is fun to see. This place is a winner!
author: Val S.

description:
Papito is a great sit-down Mexican place - nice for a quick lunch or a cozy date. The menu has a nice variety of options, including the classics as well as dishes with their own unique twist. We got a fried chicken quesadilla that came with a chipotle crema, cabbage, and some other tasty goodies inside (and was HUGE), the ceviche (also a good portion), black beans, and the beet salad. All of the food was good, not great ... with the exception of the salsa roja, which was pretty fantastic.

I do wish we had tried the sangria, which looked amazing, or some of the other fun drink or dessert options. While I wasn't wowed, this is definitely a place I would go back to if I was in the Potrero Hill area.  Points for outdoor seating, open-air interior (on a nice day) and dog-friendly patio.
author: Catie F.

description:
The best food and drinks I've had in a while! 
Our waiter was so nice and made us the best margaritas.definitely will be coming back!!
author: Noemi D.

description: Friend and I were down for trying a new restaurant and we came across this place. There's always skepticism going into new dining but this place did not disappoint. Get everything because it's sooooo delish. I had the burrito mojado and the churros and left full and happy with leftovers. Servings are big and the food is just well flavored and fresh. Check it out if you haven't already.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
WOW this place was great. Went early on a Friday evening with my mom, my wife, and my son (14, not a little kid). The place is small but comfortable; the music and hubbub were warm and engaging without being too loud for conversation. The staff was friendly and attentive; most importantly to me, they were all laughing and joking with one another. That's the sign of a good restaurant to me--if the staff is relaxed and having a good time while working. 

The food was really good---the salsas that come with the chips are super fresh; one was tomatillo-based, and I think the other was chile de arbol. Just spicy enough to be interesting without nuking your tastebuds before dinner arrives. I had the posole verde; it was not greasy at all, which can be posole's main problem. It had light, bright flavors, with a bit of crunch from the thinly sliced radishes and shredded green cabbage. The pork was tender and flavorful without being fatty. Probably the best bowl of posole I've ever had. 

The others had tacos, which they were very happy with; my mom did get the chicken enchiladas and felt they were too salty. That was our only quibble with the food. We also got the agave wine margaritas, which were very good and not very strong, which was fine with us. 

Get the churros for dessert, they were very tasty, and again, not greasy.
author: Jamey M.

description: I've came here 3 times and have tried the burrito, enchiladas & quesadillas. The food is delicious, a must taste. I would never recommend to come to this place when the two women are working here. They were the rudest people I have ever encountered. They ignored us when we spoke to them, had us sitting at the table for 30 minutes without attempting o clean it and we asked SEVERAL times. They had attitudes and one of them even tossed our change in our hand. I don't even want to give them 1 start because the food is so good & the Caucasian male who works during the day is so polite and very helpful. I suggest only coming here when he is working.
author: Tajanee D.

description:
Papito is usually the place to go for a quick and delicious burritos and nachos. With the new owners they even brought back some of the old favorites like the three salsas and they've maintain most the recipes.  

However one small change has been yo their refill policy.  Seems now there are no refills on ice tea or other drinks.  The only exception to that is if the host/hostess feels like waving this cost as "a courtesy." 

And found all this out after the bill came.  No warning on the refill charges.  Have a hard time spending $15 on a burrito +$9 dollars for three glasses of iced tea; which are half filled with ice in the first place.
author: Chris L.

description: Great Tacos! The pulled steak was the best! Very moist and with cucumber garnish! Don't forget about the Mexican corn app! Just cheesy enough! Was the perfect amount of food! And Mexican Coke!
author: Karleigh M.

description: Love the fried chicken taco salad! If you like it super hot ask for the habanero sauce from the kitchen.
author: Nikolai P.

description:
Awesome place. Really cozy. Not many seats inside, but that is fine. They have seats outside with heaters but it's San Francisco.

The menu is really interesting. We had the Sopa Ranchera and it was exactly what my girl friend needed on a cold windy day.

I had the salad with avocado and camarones and it was very tasty. The yogurtish cilantro dressing was not overbearingly creamy, which is how I like it.

The Quesadillas looked awesome on the nearby tables but we didn't try them. We are going there again. Soon.
author: Shailesh P.

description:
2.5 score. 

Price a little too high for its quality. The tacos weren't that good at all, not almost $10 worth. Really tiny, I could hear the people conversation next to us. 

Elotes were good but NOT $7 worth, that's just a joke.
author: Patty G.

description:
+ rustic shrimp enchilada was super yummy though very salty
+ cute ambiance
author: Margaret R.

description:
Starring a very unusual combination of French and Mexican foods, a local, neighborhood feel, and a solid house margarita, Papito has made my family repeat customers. We usually start with the guacamole, which always has a nice kick to it. I strongly recommend the duck confit quesadilla, which is sweet and salty (but only eat that there, don't try to get it to go - it gets soggy quickly in a to go box).

They also have a great lineup of tacos. I'm partial to the baja fish tacos and the carnitas tacos (the latter being also a little sweet and slightly cinnamon-y in the same vein as the duck confit quesadillas).

Finally, some churros are always nice to finish off a meal.
author: Marco C.

description: This place is our go-to for a perfect afternoon lunch and adult bevi. The fried chicken quesadillas are utter perfection, and totally unexpected. The margaritas are solid.  Amazing staff, nice tables outside.
author: Antonia T.

description: Muy bueno! Enjoyed the sangria and pork tacos -- Carnitas (Slow cooked berkshire pork, salsa roja, pineapple pico de gallo) and  Pastor (Marinated pork shoulder, roasted pineapple, onions, cilantro, salsa verde). Friendly service. Highly recommended!
author: michael p.

description: After our neighbors insisted, we gave this place a third try, and it's been amazing ever since.  Worth mentioning our first two times were takeout, maybe that was the issue?
author: Rego S.

description:
I had a burrito the size of my arm and am still happy (and full). Everyone who works here is super nice, and they have great hot sauce.

Cheerz.
author: Ashley B.

description:
I was there tonight, on Friday around 7 PM. Their food was pretty good and reasonable. But the service was super slow... 

To order food, we had to ask 2 waiters that we were ready to order and we finally get tp order after 30 min. To get our food to our table, it was another 20 min. To get boxes, it was another 20 min. To get the bill, that was another 30 min... I was exhausted to try to get the attention from the waiters at the end.
author: Mariko H.

description: I love Papito!! In person, delivery...nuked the next day. So consistent. Love you guys keep it up.
author: Ramon L.

description:
I've only been to Papito once but considering how crowded it was I'm taking the liberty to assume it is worthy of five stars. 

This place is great in all usual regards, but also exceptionally wonderful at making their meat taste vegetarian. Somehow I was unaware that I was splitting a chicken quesadilla because I didn't taste chicken until my coworker informed me at the end of the meal. Vegetarians, don't despair. There are indeed meatless options that I didn't order but am sure are great too. Blind faith!

They provided us with a satisfactory amount of water in a glass pitcher full to the brim with shattering potential. 

Overall wonderful I wholesomely recommend.
author: Hannah Y.

description: I LOVE this place! After living in Mexico for a short while pazole became one of my comfort foods, and finding good pazole in this city is no easy task. Papito has the BEST so far. The freshness and quality is great, the portion is huge, and the service has always been great! Although I usually come here for the soup, everything else on the menu I've tried so far has been excellent!
author: Paula R.

description:
I called to place a to go order and was put on hold longer than it took for me to actually get to this establishment. 

Once I got to this restaurant, I was not greeted properly and waited several more minutes before being acknowledged at the bar. 

After receiving my to go order I checked my order as any sane person that orders out would do. When I opened my $9 dollar box for two tacos, I find my tacos completely turned upside down. 

Then when I show the bartender who took my order what the inside of my box looks like he says "oh you must've did that when you pulled the box out of the bag."  so you mean to tell me that by me pulling the box out of the bag, all my tacos are everywhere? Good call- blame the issue on the customer . 

That was horrible preparation for to go menu items. The box needs to be smaller if that happens all the time. 

Not only did all of these issues happen; but now my stomach is rumbling! I would've been better off going to a damn taco truck. $22 wasted tonight.
author: B H.

description:
Delicious food!! Came in looking for a quick fix of Mexican food after spending all day at hospital down the street. Did not expect to hit the jackpot! 

This is seriously delicious Mexican food. Great flavors that are balanced and we'll seasoned. Small store with a big heart. Definitely recommend!
author: Ravi M.

description: This was my favorite place to eat while I lived in San Francisco. The staff is super friendly and the food is delicious. Must try: queso fundito with chorizo.
author: Josh F.

description:
Eat in! 
I'd give you 5 stars Papito, but my order is wrong 80% the time. I love you, but it's disappointing getting home only to find out your burrito order is a surprise every time... :"(

I order the same carry out every time and for some reason the order always comes out a mystery even though the receipt is correct. 
Last nights order:

1 Burrito w/ black beans,rice, & sour cream only 
1Burrito w/pinto beans,cheese,chicken,&sour cream only.

What I got this time:
1 Burrito w/black beans, cheese, breaded chicken and pico de Gallo

1 Burrito w/ pinto beans,rice, breaded chicken, pico de Gallo 

For a vegetarian this doesn't work out...
Anyone else have this problem? :( maybe I'm difficult.
author: Brittany W.

description:
Very small mexican restaurant in Potrero Hill. Also a larger location in Hayes valley. Pricier and fancier than your average mission taco shop. More comparable to a place like Tacolicious.

Elote Asado - 2/5 - Way too much mayo.
Chorizo Queso Fundido - 3/5 - Lots of chorizo, good balance of flavor.
Carnitas Taco - 2/5 - Lacked flavor
Pastor Taco - 4/5 - Pastor here was very good
Carnitas De Pato Taco - 4/5 - Duck confit was a unique addition. We transferred some of the pineapple pico from the carnitas onto this and it went perfectly together.
Papito Taco - 3/5 
Churro bites - 3/5 - Mascarpone Espresso Cream was better than the Tequila Chocolate Dip, but both were good. Churros had a nice filling in it too.

Overall, I'd come back for the pastor and duck confit tacos. "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description: AMAZING food !! And awesome service. The burrito was incredible along with everything else I ate there. Do yourself a favor and check this place out !
author: Jessica B.

description: Papito is a beautiful, small Mexican restaurant adorned with Spanish interior. Anything you order will exceed your expectations! (Both in quality and quantity, because the portions are huge). Our server was incredibly kind; he gave us free refills and on-point suggestions. The watermelon agua fresca was the best I've ever had. I love everything but my favorite dishes were the steak nachos, elotes, and tortilla soup.
author: Sally C.

description:
Overall a really solid spot! The chips and salsa were great. My partner and I ordered the posole (tasty) and steak enchiladas, unfortunately they brought some sort of shredded chicken enchiladas. The service was a bit delayed so I decided to not say anything to the waiter to not mess up my partners experience. 

I would definitely consider going back.
author: David F.

description: The soup is incredible. So full of vegetables and flavor. I love the space place and menu. Super nice people there. Definitely will be back.
author: Catherine C.

description: Had the al pastor quesadilla. Really delicious ! They had a lot of good looking options. Will probably come back to try them
author: Pierce J.

description:
This place is super overpriced, most expensive Mexican style corn every. 
The service is horrible, and how can you run a business with only one server?

5 star though because the food is so good, and when your server does come back once every blue moon? He is extremely nice and caring.
author: Charley P.

description:
Man, I am so glad that I didn't know Thee Parkside is a music venue that serves food last night, otherwise I may have never discovered Papito!

It is a very small restaurant that serves delicious organic Mexican food. It's not your average taqueria and while it is by no means a ridiculous sum for the quality food and service that Papito offers, it is priced on the slightly higher end of "casual dining". Think $12-22 for an entree. 

Service was great, we were brought a carafe of water and were constantly being offered refills on our chips and salsa. 

I ordered the regular al pastor burrito, which our server assured me was not dry in the slightest (such is my experience with many Mexican places in SF). My bf had the fried chicken (!!!) quesadilla.

We were in sort of a hurry because we did not want to be more late than we already were for the show we were catching a few blocks down. Despite this time constraint, we both enjoyed our dishes immensely.

His quesadilla came out looking absolutely fabulous. The presentation was simply tantalizing and although I didn't want to try too much of it for fear of the cheese messing with my stomach, the few bits of fried chicken I nibbled at were absolutely amazing. The perfect amount of crispiness to tender, juicy chicken ratio. And it wasn't sopping with cheese, either. It seemed to be mostly chicken and avocado with a thin layer of cheese below.

The tortillas incorporated in both of our dishes were toasted to perfection in all the right places--they had a great crunch every time you took a bite. 

My burrito was DEFINITELY not dry or like any al pastor I've ever had! The first bite I took (after, of course, cradling this thing like a baby because of its size) was rich and saucy with a sweet tang aftertaste. A few more bites in and I realized the al pastor here is cooked with pineapple! Definitely unexpected and while it wasn't totally unwelcome, I may have ordered something else had I known. Still, I thoroughly enjoyed eating a sumptuous burrito the size of my forearm and having enough leftover to warrant a snack for later.

Though I'm not sure when next time will be, as I don't get out to Potrero Hill very often, I would love to try the carnitas or fried chicken in a burrito.

Thank you, Papito, for giving me one of the most fulfilling Mexican food experiences I've had since moving to this city from San Diego 5 years ago!!
author: Megan D.

description:
Hot Tip: Order the wings. I know what you're thinking: "Why order wings at a Mexican restaurant?" Well, why does a Frenchman run a Mexican restaurant? Because he knows how to make good food!

The same purveyors of Chez Maman run Papito's and are known (at least they are in my mind) for taking a refined approach to classics. Ever tried the Maman burger? C'est magnifique! Same goes for the Paptio wings.

Sure, the tacos and ceviche are exceptional, but just try those wings. You're welcome.
author: Abby S.

description: I like papitos tacos a lot.   Papito (fried shrimp) and carnitas are my favorites.  The cerviche is pretty good.
author: Michael E.

description: Fantastic service! The tacos al pastor great, and so were all their drinks.
author: Kay D.

description: Papito is poppin'!! This place is great! People say it's small, I call it cozy. Everyone working there is extremely friendly and helpful. I ordered the chicken fajitas and let me tell you, they were absolutely divine. My dish came with warmed tortillas in tin foil, a bowl of warm rice and beans, and a sizzling hot pan of chicken, peppers, and onions. It was all fantastic. The chicken was tender, moist, crispy, sweet, chewy, juicy, and delicious. This was the best meal I'd had in a long time, except maybe for some tasty chow mein I had a few nights ago. Check out my profile and my other reviews to find out where I had it. And definitely check out Papito.
author: Daniel S.

description: I placed a large order for takeout for a dinner at my home and everything was such a hit.  The tacos were wonderful, the communication was on-point, and everything was on time.  Would highly recommend for catering or large takeout orders.
author: Laura K.

description:
Delicious Mexican food! Generous portions, clean place and great service!!!

I absolutely loved their habanero hot sauce, freshly made and delicious!
author: Tupirix S.

description: This was the only place open on the block on July 3. It was surprisingly great! The chips are top notch. Con is a single seater bathroom. Place is small and intimate. Has an outside patio as well. Braised beef was great.
author: Bill L.

description: The are on point the have good customer service and the fried chicken burrito is a must try very big portions reasonable price
author: Toine G.

description: Jonathan at the bar was awesome! Great service helped me pick out some good food on the menu. Definitely will be back Mexican gourmet food at its finest.
author: Puro V.

description: Came in here after reading the reviews. Place was not busy around 3:15pm. The food was SO delicious. I had the green chicken enchiladas. My husband had the pastor tacos and he loved them as  well. I was a little bummed because I ordered a watermelon mimosa, but they were out of champagne and had to go make a champagne run nearby, however the champagne was warm. The server offered a drink on the house which was cool. But I am still thinking of that watermelon mimosa and we live 2 hours away! Will definitely be back if we are ever in the area again.
author: Amanda M.

description:
This spot is a great find.  For some reason it's difficult to find solid Mexican food in San Francisco - you can find it, but you need to search.  I came here with two friends for brunch recently and we chose this spot due to a craving for breakfast burritos and because the wait at Plow was 1 hour and 45 minutes.

First of all, this is an "organic" restaurant and the food is very high quality.  Also the size of the restaurant its not too big nor too small (ok, maybe it's on the small side).  There's sidewalk seating with heaters if you're in an outdoorsy kind of mood, but eating in the restaurant is comfortable.  

Service was friendly and prompt, though the only issue we had (and the reason they lost a star) was that all of our orders where in some way......wrong.  First of all, my buddy was served the wrong breakfast burrito (shrimp vs. chorizo), on top of that, the two breakfast burritos were swapped between my friend and his girlfriend.  She ordered the vegi breakfast burrito, and we were happy she was not a strict veterinarian since it took a few bites of her burrito to figure out it was chorizo.  Finally, my crab cakes eggs benedict arrived sans egg.  This gaff aside, the food overall was very good and the serving size was also pretty generous.  Additionally the house salsa is nearly perfect, it tastes a little roasted and its spicy without being overly so.  Finally, they did comp some money back on our tab once we received the bill and apologized several times for the issues with our order.  

Overall, this is great neighborhood Mexican restaurant that serves some unique dishes and excellent food overall.  I hope to be back soon.
author: Tom G.

description: Loved all the choices. The salsa is delicious. We had seven different dishes and all were very happy with their meals. We would all come back for more!
author: Leslie S.

description:
Bomb diggity. 

The papito nachos (no meat) are my go-to     With an ice cold modelo especial 



I'll be back
author: Tori F.

description: Unbelievably good. The pozole soup is probably the best I've had in San Francisco hands down!! I've tried a few items and pretty much can't complain nor would !  The enchiladas are great and the quesadillas are terrific. The ceviche is extremely good too!!
author: Ethan S.

description:
Is it possible that the best Mexican restaurant in San Francisco is run by a bunch of French guys?  The answer is an emphatic "YES!".  As of tonight, I've eaten at this tiny, funky Potrero Hill joint 6 time.  Each and every time, I've been impressed and delighted by the food dished out of the cramped kitchen.  Vibrant Mexican flavors accentuated by top quality ingredients and excellent technique, served in a fun and friendly environment all add up to a wonderful experience.  The fact that the prices here are exceptionally reasonable by SF standards only sweetens the deal.

Although everything I've eaten has been great, there are some things that rise above the others.  Specifically, anything that contains the duck confit, carnitas, fried chicken (yes, I know, it sounds weird but trust me...) or the housemade chorizo.  Wash it all down with a Mexican beer or, if you're feeling fancy, a nice Malbec or Garancha.

Since I live so close to Potrero Hill, Papito has definitely become a go-to.  And like Arnold, I'll be back.
author: Bryce B.

description:
This is a nice little neighborhood Mexican restaurant. $9 for two flavorful tacos. I tried the pastor tacos this time and was pleasantly surprised at the addition of pineapple in the marinade. It was kind of like trying ham and pineapple pizza for the first time, except the pork is bursting with flavor and the bread is a soft taco shell. The tacos may look small but they are literally overflowing with meat and one bite will convince you that a lot of effort was put into designing the flavor profile of the taco. Bravo!

The restaurant isn't very large but has a nice diner counter seating area. Chips are on the house but I also recommend the guacamole if you have room for a different dancing partner for the chips.

I don't come to this area much but the view of the SF skyline and now Papito's can convince me otherwise.
author: Jerry Y.

description: This was my favorite place to go for Mexican food near my place. I order here at least 3times a month. last week I ordered the papitos combo steak and shrimp and it was cold. This week ordered the same thing and I realized the shrimp has gotten a lot smaller and the bed of lettuce isn't there anymore. I saw business ownership change outside their window. One thing I look in a restaurant is consistency and might have to look for another place in the area. Also there is an aftertaste in the shrimp.
author: Eric G.

description: Really good food, generous portions and reasonably priced, especially considering that all the ingredients are organic. Fun atmosphere and friendly service. Delivery is also great.
author: Jessica A.

description: A friend referred me here so I decided to give it a chance. I had the al pastor tacos, which were very good. The pineapple complements the meat very well. They have a green tomatillo sauce that is delicious. Also tried the new michelada with chamoy sauce and it was also very good. Its a small hole in the wall place but definitely worth it.
author: Rafael C.

description: Love this place. Great food and huge portions. Everything is well prepared with much better than average ingredients. Quesadillas are great as are the salads and tacos.
author: Phil B.

description:
Wrong food and what I got was terrible. Refused to refund. DO KOT GET FOOD FROM HERE!!! Terrible service, stale chips and mediocre food. Ordered 3 items through Grubhub. Received 2. One was wrong and had stuff requested off on it, and the chips for the other item were stale.  Also want to mention that even though I didn't receive all my food, place is charging me for everything and made half of it. And Grubhub refused to refund as well. 
Would love to do a 0 star but not available.
author: Jesus T.

description: For a neighborhood Mexican spot this place does the trick. I can only write up about the tacos because those are my jam and I never stray. The vegetarian taco, and the Hawaiian taco are both incredible. They look like small tacos but they're filled with yummy goodness so I usually order two and separate out the tortilla to get 4. Do not, I repeat do NOT forget to order churros at the end of your meal. They are next level. The service is usually great, but beware that the space is pretty small so on a Friday or Saturday night you could have to wait a bit. Not a problem because there's a great wine bar around the corner to grab a drink at in the meantime. Oh and also their salsa is spectacular. Not sure what it is that they do to make it so sweet AND spicy, but it's unlike other salsas I've had.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
Used to be a long time customer, but I have had enough. The final straw was food poisoning, which with no question was the burrito I had. Under further investigation the meat was barely cooked. 

In the past they had actually forgotten my meat in my chicken burrito- so either way I was out of luck. Not sure how their other locations are, but avoid this one. Either you'll get some stoner who doesn't care about the quality of the food or get food poisoning. 

It's sad too, they make a really great burrito.
author: Corey R.

description: I ate a $15 super burrito here recently.  Gave the place a shot since some people seem to really enjoy the food despite the high prices.  Would have to agree with people that the food is solid -- good but not great.  If food was less expensive here (even just a little), I think Papito would be a lot more appealing.
author: Daniel L.

description: The burrito was amazing AND humongous. Only thing I would ask, would be to have more sour cream in the burrito. I like tasting the coldness contrasting against the heat.
author: Saeed R.

description: It was pleasurable.  I added garlic shrimp to my marinated duck enchiladas and it was delicious!  Staff was very nice, prices are in the high end.  Parking is adequate.  Seating is very tight.  I suggest you do not bring any backpacks or big purses.  Unfortunately, I had a business meeting with my laptop and the table was tiny but next to the wall with an outlet.  I think the food won over my client.  I would highly suggest this place for lunch or dinner as a intimate meal!
author: Larry C.

description:
Recipe for a Grumpy Mamacita

Drive time: 11 minutes
Wait time (for food): 7 minutes

Ingredients:
-1 complimentary basket of chips w/ a trio of flavorless salsas: http://bit.ly/16Eavzi. 

-1 not-so-fresh (premade) beet salad w/ über soggy red onions: http://bit.ly/HoIEID. 

-1 overpriced order of $9 "IRatherHaveChevys" guacamole: http://bit.ly/1aONOV1.

-1 cold elote asado (refrigerated cold status): http://bit.ly/1cmArlF. 

-1 baja fish taco w/ half a overcooked fish stick the size of my thumb: http://bit.ly/1gViexz. 

-1 duck confit taco with a whopping one heaping tablespoon of  IThinkItsCarnitasNotDuck topped w/ soggy pickled veggies: http://bit.ly/19MU5TF. 

Yields: $60 down the drain for two

Directions:
Go to Garaje (SoMa): http://www.yelp.com/biz/garaje-san-francisco or Underdogs (Outer Sunset): http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-taco-shop-at-underdogs-san-francisco-2 instead for much better AND cheaper Mexican "fusion" food.

You're welcome!

P.S. - 2 stars are for their awesome and friendly staff.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: I love this place. Really solid food and even better service. The drinks are really no frills but the food is so flavorful and really good size portions, you will definitely take home leftovers. My favorite items are the guacamole of course and the al pastor quesadilla. Sometimes there can be a wait but it's well worth it. Really great casual neighborhood vibe.
author: Nora C. E.

description:
I got the shrimp quesadila and I enjoyed it. My friend got a pork and duck taco that look pretty tasty. We also got their mango margarita. Oooo their churro dessert was delicious. 

This place gets pretty busy but the staff takes care of you. I'm coming back to try other items on the menu.
author: Ange G.

description:
Messed up a simple order.
Didn't label the burritos so we had to cut into them to figure what burrito went to who. Over priced but I guess that's okay if you cater to hipster millennials. Don't waste your money here.
author: Tom B.

description:
This place is 1) delicious, 2) nice ambiance, 3) easy to park near 4) diverse menu where you are bound to find something you like.

I went for the duck quesadilla. Not in the LEAST bit disappointed. When I think Mexican food in SF, I think, either dry meat in my quesadillas/burritos or two tiny tacos for $15. This place just shot past the low bar I had set. Love it. Great place to get together with friends or for a date.
author: Melissa T.

description: This is the place to be. If I were to choose a place to come back to on multiple occasions this would be the one. There was great customer service, my waiter's name was Jorge and he was beyond amazing and made sure everything went perfectly. The food was delicious and presented beautifully. I also enjoyed the ambience so overall I give this place 5 stars.
author: Jade F.

description: This is my favorite organic mexican place in town. I went with my fiancee for her birthday  (mexican food is her fav) and she loved it too! We ordered fajitas and pozole and they reminded me of my abuelitas cooking. She came north after the Mexican revolution, when some banditos stole her mother. She made good fajitas and pozole, and so does papito. The owner - manager guy, Dave, was a charming sweetheart. When I told him it was my fiancee's birthday, he comped us delicious churros. Strong margaritas and cool deco round out this diamond on the rough.
author: sean d.

description: Churros are amazing and Pazole is equally delicious. Small place, but excellent staff who really take of you. We were bloated, satiated, and smiling after our meal. We'll definitely be coming back.
author: Tory F.

description:
YES. The mole dish is the dish I keep coming back for. The shrimp ceviche is also not to be missed. 
Added bonus is the food is organic, and that the service is great.
It's a small spot, so be weary for expecting to walk in and sit down. However, by chance, I've been able to time it perfectly.
author: Amy O.

description:
I really liked Papito!

I had a duck taco: there was plenty of meat, and a shrimp taco: good-sized shrimp (about 3) with yummy mango squares & veggies.

For all you dairy free foodies - the servers asks if you want sour cream on top (in any case, it's just a little squirt when you choose to have some!).

The fresh corn tortillas tasted good. The portions are pretty light, as in my husband could have definitely had a third taco (but you order them by two!). He had the fish taco he liked. It's all healthy and organic ingredients so you feel pretty dang good coming out of there!

It was cool to eat outside in front of the store, get a bit of sun shining and be able to watch my bike, parked in front ;-)

The staff was friendly and we appreciated the iced water brought over immediately and the corn chips with salsa offered. 

I'll go back when I crave tacos!!
author: Leslie S.

description: So far I've tried the Super Burrito twice - once with chorizo and once with carnitas.  Both were excellent, as was the guacamole, and the service.  The brownish hot salsa (habanero?) that they serve is nice and spicy and has a great taste to it as well.  Highly recommend.
author: Dave H.

description: I was at papito Potrero hill yesterday with some friends and the food and drinks were amazing but the most important Gorge was amazing and friendly and the service was great I felt like home and I do recommend this place if you are trying to have a chill time with friends or family this is the perfect place thank you Gorge.
author: Alma M.

description: Best tacos I've ever ate!! Amazing service and always great vibes. I'm addicted to this place.
author: Bob L.

description: I had an amazing night with my friends at papito's restaurant! Jorge was an amazing waiter and the service was excellent. Food was amazing and drinks where good! If your looking for a nice place to have a good dinner this is the place to be!!!
author: Flakita C.

description:
If my first 2 visits were not positive experiences, I would not have gone back the 3rd time.    This experience alone would have been a 2 at best, but averaging it out, I went with a 3.   Honestly, on each of my 3 visits, the customer service has always been lacking, but the food has made up for it.     I'm cant understand how ... With 4-5 people working, at a place the size of a studio apartment with 6 tables and as many bar seats, with nearly as many customers as staff each time we were there.... you'd expect that the staff... who stands around lollygagging with each other and their bar customer the majority of the time, would take the opportunity to sho better customer service.    People pay restaurant prices - Not so much for the food they can make at home... but much for the service and personality you get when you go out.    the Staff should check in and see if we needed more water, napkins, or anything else... but the overall pretentious vibe of the place (perhaps its the French influence) certianly does affect the customer service here... not just this last time... but pretty much each time.     

As far as the food, if you like paying 17 for a wet steak burrito that most any other place would have been half the price and twice the size... and probably just as enjoyable.    The salsa... well... its just ketchup with some Tapatio mixed in.   But the habanero salsa is pretty good, and helps add some flavor to the food... if you could get the attention of one of the staffers to reach over and squeeze it out of the bottle for you, witch takes only 10 seconds, but getting someones attention takes 5 minutes.      

Overall... after 3 times... and never that impressed... I my go back... but likely I won't.   Its just too pricey for the quality of the food and quantity of the portions, and the customer service does not make up for the difference.
author: Vlad C.

description: Great spot, great neighborhood. Love coming here after playing tennis on weekends. The Quesadilllas are my go to
author: Anant P.

description: My brother said "this is my favorite place to order a burrito. Not just in San Francisco, but anywhere." That is quite the statement, but the burritos here are truly spot on. My first visit I tried the tacos, it was a pretty decent experience. I came back to order a burrito and was extremely pleased with my choice. This thing is huge! The meat is well cooked, and the flavor is incredible. I ordered Al Pastor, which included delicious chunks of pineapple. The chips here are also really good, which is always an indicator of a Mexican restaurants overall quality. The restaurant is very small and cozy, with a couple outdoor tables as well. Very lovely place, with high quality food. I highly recommend!
author: Alex E.

description:
Olivier. is. awesome. Think: outspoken, funny, energetic French dude serving some damn good Mexican food. He remembers my friend who's gone there a bunch recently, and makes fun of all of us in a good-humored way. 

* Homemade Guacamole (chips + dip free) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papito-san-francisco?select=EikTQWLkltig6HLZq0v9Kg#EikTQWLkltig6HLZq0v9Kg
(avocado, cilantro, lime, queso fresco, jitomate, fresh tortilla chips. $7)
Very tasty, chunky, and fresh. The mango salsa.. the mango salsa!!! It is fantastic. We went through about 5 bowls of this stuff and 

* Papa Con Chorizo taco - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papito-san-francisco?select=EikTQWLkltig6HLZq0v9Kg#bTv08zYognYkxJb0UK5M0g
(homemade mexican chorizo, potatoes, salsa verde, pico de gallo. $4.50)
The chorizo is on the softer side, not as much the slightly charred crispy type I like. But the flavor is great and everyone loves the potato this comes with. 

* Carnitas De Pato taco - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papito-san-francisco?select=EikTQWLkltig6HLZq0v9Kg#bTv08zYognYkxJb0UK5M0g
(duck confit carnitas, homemade pickles, mint, chipotle tamarind sauce. $4.50)
Underwhelming.. there is just less quantity of stuff on this taco and the meat does not have much flavor.

* Sopa Ranchera - 3 stars
(traditional soup, zucchini, carrot, tomato, corn, red rice, cilantro, jalapeno, chicken. $7.50)
Just a simple broth, tried a spoonful of my friend's - not too much that's impressive here.

* Steak super burrito - 3.5 stars
(Spanish rice, black beans, pico de gallo, monterey jack cheese, guacamole, crème fraiche. $9.50)
Tried a bite of my friend's - the meat is very soft, seemed good but the meat was concentrated in the middle with more rice on the edges.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Give me a dirty taqueria over a fancy one any day. 

Except when it's Papito. 

From the trio of sauces (green tomatillo, yellow mango and red smoky chili), duck confit tacos to its Watermelon agua fresca, everything is just prepared well. 

While most yelpers recommended the tamarind sauce based duck confit tacos, I prefer the fried chicken tacos with the Chipotle remoulade sauce and creme fraiche.  Two tacos cost $9, pricey but Papito boasts of organic ingredients.

Do NOT miss the chunky guac with the queso fresco, it's very addicting!
author: Janice C.

description: Went here for lunch and had the wet super burrito with beef and it was very delicious and the portion was very satisfying. I could not eat the whole burrito. The chips and salsa were average so the salsa could be improved. The service was excellent and they were very friendly. They even gave us a free round of drinks. I think they felt for our hospital experience since we had been at UCSF for many hours waiting. Never the less it was very nice of them. I would go back here again when I am in the area and have a Mexican food craving.
author: Brian W.

description:
What a great place to go!  I was killing time in the neighborhood, and saw this little place.

The staff was friendly, and I was early enough for dinner that I was seated right away.  The food came out pretty quickly, and the flavors were so much more than I would've imagined at that location.  I mean, a burrito outside of the mission?  Gasp!  How could it be?!

The chips, salsa, and burrito were all so flavorful, and the price was right.  I thought they were affordable (though not dirt cheap), and the place was great for what I was looking for.  Pleasantly surprised all around.  I can imagine it gets crowded, given the small space, but as long as the wait wasn't more than 20-30 minutes, it'd be totally worth it.
author: Jes G.

description:
This is probably one of the best mexican places I've ever been to! I had some of that tacos and they were to die for. The free chips and salsa were excellent as well. The place is small but as long as you don't have a huge group you'll be good!! 

Also there is outdoor seating as well. Great for a nice day. Highly recommend this place!
author: Gabrielle P.

description:
Shrimp taco!! Can't go wrong with them. I had three of them and was so full but I still wanted more.

The shrimp is fresh and I love the salsa toppings. 

Recommended!
author: Christina N.

description: Food is good. Service is quite lackluster, if not rude at times. So, I usually get my food to go.
author: R S.

description:
I walked in first time today based on all the yelp reviews. sadly dissapointed. I ordered to go the baja taco which sounded tasty. I asked NO SOUR CREAM. Mind you , Im pregnant so theres a reason I didnt want sour cream, as it made me want to vomit! The guy told the cooks "no sour cream". great , now to wait for my tasty tacos! so I happily get my order , almost get home and guess what? theres SOUR CREAM ALL OVER my tacos. I cant even wipe it off. EWWWW. So I drive my pregnant self back and ask for a new order, given their mistake. guess what? NO APOLOGY whatsoever from the guy who took the order or the distracted cooks for that matter. 

So I just left and this time checked before leaving. The tacos were as I wanted with a chipotle mayo which looked good. Sadly the taste was subpar, flavorless. All I tasted was the batter and cabbage. gross!

I really had high hopes for this place , but wouldnt go back. Instead of talking while listening to orders the cooks should pay more attention. No thanks.
author: Christina M.

description: A great place for Mexican food. Tiny but worth the wait!
author: Christi H.

description: We love everything about this place.  Friendly service with a smile, quality food, generous portions and the staff is extremely generous.  If you're in this neighborhood don't miss a visit to Papito.  If you're not in the neighborhood, make the drive!
author: Brian S.

description:
This is one of those neighborhoody hole in the wall places that you expect to have simple and good food and great service.  This place had 2 of the 3. 

The place is very basic, tables, chairs, the ones outside not the most comfortable and you do sit on a bit of an incline being in Potrero.  It's a bit cramped inside but nothing unusual. 

The food was good, guacamole, chips, fish, chicken and beef tacos.  Everything tasted fresh, it wasn't heavy as Mexican food can be. The guacamole was pre-made, I kinda like the places that make it fresh, and they are certainly small enough to be able to do this.  The Malbec was quite bad, it tasted like pretty much nothing.

So why the bad rating?  The tables are metal and they gave us awful laminated menus, we figured out what we wanted and were trying to hand them back to the waiter, in his response he was quite rude, and told us that the menus are used as place mats to protect the tables and shoved them under our drinks and appetizers.  

First, please print paper menus, these are awful and remind me of some cheap places that never change their menu or have any sense of style or etiquette.  Second, your metal table won't be harmed by the food, and if it is, either get a different one or figure out a better way to protect it, and certainly don't tell your diners they have to eat on the menus.  If it wasn't 3pm and us being hungry and a lot of restaurants being closed, we would have left.
author: Inga W.

description: Good food, reasonable prices for the area. My tuna was a little over cooked but the flavors were spot on.
author: None O.

description:
My new favorite Mexican restaurant.. Small places always have the best food !!!!! 
I want start off with my waiter he was such a sweet heart he hooked up me and my lover and showed us some good hospitality  . The good food wAs also delicious I got to steak tacos very flavorful and it wasn't just hella chopped up meat  it was nice bite size carne. My lover also got enchiladas an that was bomb as well all in all this place was just a fab place 
And I was suprised when I got there because I was expecting something else it's was worth the wait and planning to comeback soon
author: Gracelove C.

description: This was definitely one of the better Mexican food places that I have been to. I was skeptical at first but the service was great! I got a pastor taco and a carnitas taco. It's a cute French/Mexican fusion leaning more towards the Mexican side! Organic place as well...I think? I don't quite remember. But I will definitely be coming back to try other things. A drawback though is probably the price. Literally was $11 for my tacos with tax/tip. At least it comes with free salsa and chips?? Since I got there ahead of time (about 10 min early) the manager (I think it was him) gave me free guac--which is always awesome.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Damn good Mexican food, a step up from a taqueria with quality ingredients, great flavor and lots of options. Dave gave us great service, it was like hanging out with an old friend.
I'll be back.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Looking for a quaint hispanic organic restaurant in Potrero Hill?  Look no further than Papito.  It's a small place (seating is limited, maybe 4-5 tables that fit small parties), but the menu has a wide variety of choices.  You can choose from entree specials to burritos to quesadillas and tacos.  I had a carnitas super burrito, but beware that they charge extra to add meat (additional $2).  We were given complimentary chips with three different salsa (green salsa, regular salsa, and a mango sauce). All were very tasty, but the premium price for organic mexican food was a little much for me (considering I live in the Mission and have access to a wealth of cheap, authentic taquerias).

Nevertheless, this place is clean, the service is great, and most of all on a sunny day, the outdoor seating has a gorgeous view of the city!
author: Robert T.

description:
Shout out to Owen M, Mish L, and Joe M. whose great reviews led me to this cozy French inspired Mexican bistro on top of Potrero Hill. 

Ordered their taco plate ($9) which comes with two. From their selection of chorizo, shrimp, carnitas, vegetarian, etc., their duck confit carnitas and negro modelo baja tacos sounded the best. I liked how you could split the order.  

* DUCK CONFIT TACO - Tender and succulent! The homemade pickled (daikon?), mint, and chipotle tamarind sauce gave a refreshing ying to the confit'd duck's (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/aaDHYyIJGa5EFrFT2WAf7Q?select=dzgrwAW7fhdWO_atSIbt7A)     

* BAJA TACO - The negro modelo batter gave a crisp crunch to the meaty rock cod. As good as this taco was, I've accepted the reality that SF can't mess with SD for fish tacos. This version reminded of the fish taco from the Street Eatz food truck. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/aaDHYyIJGa5EFrFT2WAf7Q?select=TsCGZUMWq4d7eYWxpAoJ5g)

* HAMBURGESA $11- The patty is a blend of chorizo and beef, unlike Don Pisto's which is marinated in bacon, this version was like a smooth Mexican meatloaf. Caramelized onions, queso, and avocado on a lightly toasted ciabatta rounded out the burger. Wasn't a fan of their soggy wedge cut fries. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/aaDHYyIJGa5EFrFT2WAf7Q?select=t8p9EGqlXEis9A4xOfn_Vg)

Stick with the fusion-y items. Definitely worth a visit to this casual neighborhood joint even if you're not from the neighborhood. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/aaDHYyIJGa5EFrFT2WAf7Q?select=zw0B9PvYXvKbVjy_aK4JDg)
author: Earl G.

description:
I work near Papito and head here for lunch from time to time.  The food is very good, but it is vastly overpriced.  Recently I ordered their veggie enchiladas - (4) 4" very decent (but not mind blowing) enchiladas with beans + rice, no beverage and the total was $16.90 after tax.  Ouch!  I left feeling taken advantage of.  
I highly recommend the rock fish tacos; they are delish (have them skip the feta crumble(?) as it's out of place with the rest of the flavors).
author: Jen D.

description:
Carnitas de Pato is the best taco I have EVER EATEN. Also got the carne asana tacos and the frijoles negros, tasty, but nothing to write in all caps on Yelp about. 

Sunny day seating for two on the front patio area. I'll definitely be back.
author: Adele A.

description: LOVE the food, high quality (yes, organic and healthy Mexican), good deal for the price.  Yummy sangria.  Outdoor sitting if you have a dog.    Inside is a bit small, but it's great for a quick bite.
author: Ania B.

description:
We have always loved coming to Papito since we moved back to Potrero Hill. However, in the past few weeks the service, food, and operations have gone down hill. 
Seems the servers on any given night cannot manage the few tables along with take out orders. They have stopped answering the phone to place take out orders so we have tried using Grub Hub, that only works if the servers place the order. We have walked here the last few times to place our order since they don't answer the phone. This seems to take at least an hour to get our food, and most of the time they get the order wrong. 
It is obvious they need 2 servers on most nights and they could use a server with a tad bit more energy. The staff a few months ago were always super attentive and friendly, now they seem to be indifferent and a bit rude. Sorry to say we will need to look for a new favorite Potrero Hill special spot. It's nice to see that this sweet little spot with great food become so successful, however, we see the sweet spot fading as quality and kindness have been replaced by quantity. This place has become way to stressful to deal with after an already stressful day.  We are very sad To say the Papito experience is no longer.
author: Mark N.

description: You can't miss with any of the food, but be prepared to know what you want right away as the wait staff can be a little pushy. The margarita's are my favorite in the city.
author: Nora M.

description: Tiny little Mexican spot with very limited seating. Wait staff was very attentive and the food came out quickly. I had the shrimp enchiladas, which were very flavorful. They had free chips and salsa as well, and the salsa was great - that's even compared to my typical tex-mex fare so it's saying a lot for me!
author: Alex H.

description:
(I deleted my last review by accident, here's a short version)
