description: Best quesadilla of my life.  San Francisco, your excellent food makes it almost excusable that your arrogant douchebag little brother San Jose takes itself so seriously.
author: In LA ..

description:
One can only imagine how many obstacles Papitos had to clear to FINALLY open this little joint. There had to have been more than the usual because the stop and go flow just about put me off completely. We are open. We are not open. We are open (maybe). Hmm.

Anyway managed to eat dinner on a Friday night soon after the doors opened at 5:30. Got a table. Good waitstaff. Ordered the tomato/cactus salad which came with onion rings (onion rings?) on top. It was merely fair, lacking in individual flavorings; everything ran together. The shrimp taco was very good. My husbands shrimp burrito was tasty as well. But the real reason I give this long anticipated restaurant only two stars is their guacamole, which SUCKED! Just a gloppy. slurpy, slippery, tasteless paste. I reveal my prejudice when I say that I prefer my guacamole to be chunky but I can get over that if it is deliciously flavored. This was not and frankly, the guac is an acid test for any Mexican restaurant because it is so easily prepared; almost hard to ruin. But Papitos did. I will try again as I have long waited for a taqueria to come my Hill. 

Step it up, Papito. You guys are better than this.
author: Lynka A.

description: The duck confit burritos here are inconsistent. Sometimes they're perfect, and other times the duck is swallowed up in rice and beans, with hardly any pico de gallo. Maybe it only happens during the lunch rush. The times I've ordered during non-peak periods, the burrito has been perfect.
author: Larf P.

description: We found this Potrero gem after swim class!  We ordered a variety of their soft tacos (as much as I would love to eat them all each time, we can manage about 5 between the two of us).  My children love the huevos and their burgesa!  And of course, the piping hot, freshly made churros were the bomb!  I can also do shots of their dipping sauces but I have just enough will power to not embarrass my family.
author: G. W.

description: By far the most intuitive Mexican food with authentic fusion flare I have ever had. The environment is incredible, small and personable. The staff  helpful, joyful and passionate!  The over all environment just puts a smile on your face!  An absolute must for anyone who desires great authentic Mexican food!!
author: Damion H.

description: This is our go-to restaurant in the neighborhood.  The weekend specials are so creative and have proven so tasty, that we are tempted to not default to our go to dishes - the ensalada papito with the spicy grilled shrimp, and the el pastor super burrito.  Olivier brings the charm, Angel brings his hard work and friendliness to the tables, and the cooks just kill it in the kitchen - we can attest to this at least once a week for the past year!
author: Amy C.

description: I was really impressed with this place.  I have been here twice now and was very impressed with the food both times.  The fist time I was there I got the duck taco and second time I got a fried chicken quesadilla.  Everything about the food was awesome!  Would come back again for sure!
author: Ryan H.

description: Delicious quesadilla! And flan! Totally the hidden, new spot for a late lunch or early diner.
author: Fausto G.

description:
High-quality, organic ingredients = great mexican food!

I wouldn't exactly call it authentic, but that's not at all an insult. My guy LOVES their fried chicken burrito, and I'm happy with pretty much everything I've had there--all their seafood dishes are fantastic, especially the ceviche. The chicken, no matter what it's in, is always very moist and cooked to perfection. Definitely a great casual neighborhood spot. Service is fast, attentive, and amicable, just like their sister restaurant, Chez Maman.
author: Kaitlyn L.

description:
Very cute, an intimate addition to the Potrero hill area.  You can tell they use good ingredients, and take pride in there food.  We tried 4 different types of tacos and they were all unique and delicious.  Very affordable for the area.

we went back last night and it was even more delicious than the first time we were there!  the service is excellent and they are dog-friendly for their outside seating.  (they even filled our dog bowl with water, very nice.)
author: Jared M.

description: Very good food. Well made. Friendly fast service. The only down side is that it is a bit small and cramped, but given the area and the cost of real estate, I can forgive it completely.
author: Erin M.

description: My friend John asked me to try this restaurant. At first, I really didn't want too. Since I'm not a fan of Mexican food. But boy of boy I was wrong. After trying their taco with shrimp,mango, and avocado. I was like WOW, so good. There salsa was delicious too.  Very cute and cozy place to dine.
author: Aniko N.

description: Great enchiladas and tacos. Same owners as Chez Maman and Chez Papa.
author: Kevin R.

description: Really fair price for delicious mexican food. I'm moving to Potrero Hill and the waiter was so friendly and spoke so positively about my new neighborhood! Huge selection of fantastic quesadillas for 11-12 bucks... think I'll be coming here often.
author: Charlotte C.

description: We have been going there for two years now and it's been consistently friendly, great tasting food, kids friendly, good service and cozy. We like the fajitas, quesadillas (camaron de consteno) and cheese quesadilla for the kids. The three salsas for the chips are worth getting. There can be a wait outside at peek ours (you sign in your name) but the view and/or a conversation makes it somewhat easy.
author: Mpunkt H.

description:
I will not let some empty review trashing down my new favorite Mexican spot like this. 

The tortillas are fine! 
I even asked the waitress one day about it and she went straight to the kitchen bringing me back some info. 

Here is what I remember which is important for a carb watcher like me: 
- Only 40 calories per tortillas
- And only 10 grams of carbs in it. 

Not only they taste great, they are quite healthy as well! 

And with organic ingredients, WHAT should we ask more?????

TE QUIERO PAPITO
author: Mina T.

description: Have to say that the food was good. Definitely overpriced, especially for the two small tacos that cost $9!! Though the enchilada portions were adequate. However the quality of the food was greatly overshadowed by the lack of customer service and rudeness of our waiter. If you're willing to overlook smugness and pretension for good food, then go for it. Otherwise, there's plenty of good Mexican food elsewhere in the city where you'll pay for both good food and GOOD SERVICE.
author: Nicole H.

description: I would give this spot a 2.5 if I could which is probably why it always looks so easy to get a table. Of the three chez restaurants, I would go to chez maman every time. Tacos were just ok in a town that has delicious Mexican food. Sangria was nothing to write home about (a couple of teenie pieces of fruit floating in what otherwise tasted like white wine) and the churros were cold and unfortunately tasted premade.
author: Ashley C.

description:
tres bien, guac, ceviche, salsa tasting, cava, agua fresca, even the veggie tacos
yumm
author: sadao n.

description: The food is fresh and tasty and the service is friendly and professional.   Papito makes surprisingly good food,  but it's not really Mexican at all. It's French food using Latin style. Do not expect great salsa or cilantro or anything that has a Mexican flavor. If you don't mind spending a bit more for a fancy French take on a  quesadilla, you will really like the one they serve.
author: ludmilla r.

description: What a cute little place! Mexican and French fuse here, and I liked the combo. I had the duck confit tacos and they were yummy! We had so much fun eating and "dancing" to Zumba music ;) We emptied our red and white sangria carafes, did a shot of tequila with the server/owner, and shared the bread pudding and chocolate lava cake. It was a fabulous way to start the night!
author: Akiko T.

description: This is one of my favorite local restaurants. The Mexican-French blend on the menu is fantastic. I recommend the baja fish and vegetarian tacos. Add the black beans. If you're in the mood for more, try the ceviche. Don't forget to try the sangria.
author: Jeremiah L.

description: First time visiting Papito. We sat at the bar and were served drinks very quickly by a  friendly and welcoming server. Margaritas are excellent, tho not made with tequila so be warned. Chips were great, as were selection of salsas. We shared the beet salad, very tasty. Although I was really looking forward to it, I was disappointed in the duck confit taco. It was totally dry and tasteless. I knocked off a star for this. Maybe it was an off night since a lot of the reviewers mention it  The fish taco was great however. I would come again and give the duck confit another try.
author: Melissa b.

description:
Papito is truly a wonderful neighborhood gem in Potrero Hill. It may be small but its portions and taste is enormous! Excellent food! We have had lunch here several times over the past few months. The service is very good and the ingredients always fresh and delicious. Their Sopa Ranchera is an amazing burst of flavor and healthy goodness! I order it every time and given its abundance of veggies and chicken can usually serve as an entrée.  If you have room, I would recommend the Homemade Guacamole and their Ceviche Papito which gives any other ceviche restaurant a challenge for its freshness and taste.
UPDATE 4-3-2012: Today I enjoyed a light lunch of the Sopa Ranchera. It is so consistant and excellent as usual. Our waiter was professional, attentive and very help! I walked away after dining and was half way up the hill when he came running after me to give my left behind iPhone. Now that is service! Thanks, I'll be back again and again.
author: Michael R.

description: I have a love/hate relationship with this place.  I love it because it's so delicious and I hate it because it's so delicious...why?  Well, because it's literally two blocks away from my apartment and I know it'll be the end of me.  I'll need to up my working out to eat all the delicious things on Papito's menu.  I've had the carne asada tacos, shrimp tempura quesdailla and flan.  I enjoyed all of it but my favorite has to be the shrimp tempura.  I'm still dreaming about how yummy it was.  The shrimp was big and tender and tasted so fresh.  It had that fresh sea taste so massive amounts of marinating was unnecessary.  They really emphasized the freshness of their local ingredients and what a payoff.  I can't wait to go back here for more.
author: Karen N.

description: I love, love, love this restaurant. It's Mexican food with a slightly more upscale flare. The ingredients are freshers, healthier, and more sophisticated than what you find at your typical Mexican joint in San Francisco. I recommend the tacos because you can mix and match from the 8 or 9 different options they serve. They are all quite good. If you hungry, I recommend the quesadillas. They are equally good and there's no way you don't leave feeling full. Normally, I'm not a big fan of chips but the ones they serve at Papitos are delicious and the salsas and guacamole they provide are equally good. My only complaint is that they didn't name the restaurant "Ay Papito."
author: Juan V.

description: This place is everything people say it is. I was a bit skeptical about a French-owned Mexican restaurant, but the food blew me away. We tried the chicken quesadilla, the duck tacos, and the tempura shrimp tacos to go. We got 3 different kinds of salsa, all of them very different in flavor, but all very good. Everything we tried was insanely good, like blow your mind type of good. I'm glad I don't live too close because I'd be here all the time and I'd blow up like a blimp. The food is more fusion than strictly "Mexican", but that's what I expected, and it's obvious by looking at the menu. The interior is extremely small, with only a few tables and a small bar. There are a few tables outside as well and I do love the neighborhood. I'd love to come back and eat outside on a nice day and throw back a couple of sangrias.
author: Maria V.

description: I went here while visiting SF for brunch. I checked out the menu online before going to the restaurant and chose a dish, but once I got there I found out they don't serve that dish anymore. I then asked for another version of the same dish that I found on the menu (poached eggs), only to find that they didn't serve that one either. After ordering a third dish, it wasnt even prepared the way it was described on the menu, and I was overall disappointed. The food was decent, but service and failure to serve items on both the online and in store restaurant was disappointing.
author: Natasha K.

description: I eat out a lot  ....holes in the wall ...upscale,  neighborhood gems....etc and I don't usually make  a Yelp review unless it's warranted ...that being said, Papito is your neighborhood gem ..(geez.. I don't  even live in that area) but boy...good food and excellent customer service..... Paolo.....Merci beaucoup!  You can make customers feels like they're dining five star restaurant...Bravo!
author: Carrie F.

description:
This isn't  real Mexican food.  It definitely is meant for a more "gringo" palate.  This makes sense if you know that the restaurant is owned by the same people as Chez Maman/Chez Papa.  Why would you trust French people to cook Mexican food?  There are plenty of real Mexican and Latino restaurants  in SF so why would you come here? 

The only saving grace of this place is the habanero salsa.
author: C T.

description: Love the soup and the tacos are wonderful.  Have eaten here a couple of times.  I do have a complaint though, and that is that the guacamole is $9, which is completely absurd.  Especially considering most of the plates are cheaper than that too.  The waiter asked "would you like some guacamole?" as if that were maybe a small addition to the order-- not the most expensive thing in the order.  It arrived in a small cup and was frankly not the most amazing guacamole either.  I'd probably have rated them at least 4 stars if it wasn't for that.
author: Brendan B.

description: Consistently RUDE!!! We live in the neighborhood, so consider this a local spot... it's usually busy, especially when the weather is nice, so we often call in our order. EVERY time (4 times now) we have been treated rudely. Both on the phone when we are giving our order, and when picking up the food in person. It's like you are completely inconveniencing them, and they are doing you a favor by doing their jobs (providing you food for payment). RUDE, RUDE, RUDE. After our experience today, we will never go back again. It's too bad because we are happy to support a local businesses, but no way we are subjecting ourselves to that kind of experience again. Food is good, prices are high, service is terrible.
author: Brigitte M.

description: I was very impressed with Papito from the service to the sangria.  After overhearing the taco favorites from the manager who was helping the table next to ours, I took his advice and ordered the carne asada taco and Papito taco.  Boy was I glad to have eavesdropped!  The Papito taco consisted of tempura shrimp that had crunch from the outside in, pickled radish, avocado, and a sauce that was delicious.  My next taco was also flavorful with tender carne asada, carmelized onions, radish, guacamole, and salsa.  The guacamole and chips were fresh and perfect, and my boyfriend enjoyed his chicken burrito.  The best part...red sangria.  It was just right to my palate, not too sweet.  The service was very attentive and all the other items on the menu look enticing, especially the duck confit taco.  I will be back for more!
author: Linda P.

description: Papito is exactly what it intends to be... Great food! Great service! Lovely atmosphere... It's the perfect whole in the wall Mexican breakfast joint... Not fancy, just relaxed and delicious... Open to the street... The food was served piping hot, fresh and spicy! (can't speak to dinner menu but breakfast was wonderful!)
author: James H.

description: Awesome addition to the Hill. While not exactly inspired, they do add a little twist that makes this more than your standard taqueria fare, and in some cases the results are outstanding. The tortilla soup, for example, is *great*. Tacos are good. Burritos, well, I'm still trying them. Dinner specials also very good. Great to have you on the hill.
author: Bowen D.

description: There is a damn good reason why this teeny tiny place is always super busy.  The food is soooo good.  Came here recently and shared with a friend the duck tacos, chicken quesadillas, and some chips & salsa.  Everything was super fresh, spicy, and very tasty.   I highly recommend the duck tacos!  I can't wait to come back and try some different stuff.  Service is also excellent - our server was really friendly and helpful.
author: Preethi C.

description: This review and rating is for the dark haired waitress SPECIFICALLY, who was working July 7th around 5 PM, and NOT THE FOOD. We didn't even get to START our meal because the service was so unexplainably horrible, we asked for the check early and left! After hearing reviews from other customers that the service had gone all the way downhill, my boyfriend and I still decided to give it a chance. Reviews don't always give you the whole story, and they're not always reliable or credible. But I'll tell you this, you can rely on COLD, and rude service when you come to Papito's in Potrero Hill. From the moment we walked in, there was absolutely no hospitality or warmth. This girl acted like we were bothering her, as if we as paying customers, were burdensome. C'mon girl, get it together, YOU HAVE ONE JOB. By far one of the worst experiences I've had in San Francisco, to date. I can't even remember a time ever that I walked out of a restaurant.
author: Tiana P.

description:
i thought that we were in for a bad meal once we were seated.  i mean what do french dudes know about mexican cuisine?  well i shouldn't have doubted that sentiment especially since we felt the same way right before we ate at frontera in chicago.  papito, though, isn't authentic mexican.  it's mexican w/ french flare and it works.

we just wanted dinner so we decided to jump right in.  i got two tacos, one with duck confit and the other with fried chicken.  she got the enchiladas but with veggies instead of meat.  the tacos were excellent with the top nod going to the duck confit one.  the duck was crispy, juicy and flavorful.  the fried chicken was good but i kinda wish i did two duck confit ones.  her enchiladas were good but they did had a tad bit of sweetness that did throw it off a bit.

we got agua frescas with our meal.  she ordered the watermelon and i got the tamarind.  both were nice and refreshing.

overall, it was a nice experience.  the owners were working the small dining room and were charming and friendly.  we'd go back for the other interesting menu items and relaxed atmosphere.
author: Swarup B.

description: Came here before a show at the Bottom of the Hill based on Yelp reviews. My friend and I had our minds set on the duck confit burritos before we even arrived. I got mine wet style and the coloradito sauce was tasty but when I come back i'll get it normal so I can eat it with my hands. We sat outside next to some people with a small, well behaved dog and the guy working the counter brought the dog a little drink of water and a small taste of carnitas. I love homey customer service like that and the carnitas smelled so damn good I was ready to get on all fours on the sidewalk and knock that little puppy out of the way. Also, they had mexican Coke in the glass bottle, which for me really puts the icing on the cake as far as a perfect taqueria dinner goes.
author: Joshua G.

description: Must try -- Fried chicken tacos!!!  Friendly service, and easy to park too!  I also like their grilled corn, and guacamole.  Complimentary chips with 3 sauces were very good too.
author: Elena L.

description: I always had a pretty good experience when I ate there, but last night I decided to pick up... and -what a disappointment!! I ordered Camaron Costeno quesadilla, which I had several times at the restaurant and it was excellent. Well, $13 dollars were wasted on a much smaller portion, soggy stuff (didn't feel freshly made at all)  that had way fewer shrimps than normally, with the side of salsa and chutneys not even enough for the half of the meal...Not the way to keep your customers... I might give them another chance considering my previous good experience, but wouldn't rush to take out from them again.
author: Tamara F.

description: Love coming here mid-week to kick back with a cerveza and eat some great tacos al pastor.
author: Rebecca K.

description: I had a fantastic, head-sized burrito. So. Frickin. Good. Also, the guacamole was super tasty as well.
author: Alex S.

description: Great French/Mexican fusion lunch with high quality ingredients. Burritos and quesadillas recommended. Sit outside in the sun, or at the bar.  It's all good.
author: Dave B.

description:
what i ordered... super burrito w/ duck confit

good size burrito and good rice filling but that's about it.... sauce in the burrito was weird...... kinda sweet and duck confit was tasteless, a bit gamy and not melt in your mouth tenderness.  the tiniest portion sauce(s) on the side didn't help as well, they were also weird in taste and texture, trying too much to differentiate themselves from normal taquerias.... oh! maybe because they're an organic restaurant.

ambiance... good (cute and clean)
service... good
cost... $+ (expensive but the ingredients were supposedly better)
author: Gors P.

description: Serving of the burrito is amazing, the taste is even more amazing! Prices are good for the burritos, the tacos are a bit pricey though. Side of guac is a bit steep as well. But overall, the food was amazing. There was only 1 server for the Sunday shift which resulted in a little slow of service but the friendliness made up for that. I would def go here again.
author: Dakota C.

description: I love this place.  Great sangria.  I get the corn every time I come here.  Fish tacos and ceviche are great as is almost everything else I've had.  I wouldn't call it traditional Mexican, but it most certainly captures great Mexican flavors and has great atmosphere to boot.   Well painted with flattering lighting.  But it is TINY.  Only a few more seats then Chez Maman, but several actual tables rather then just bar seating.  That being said, I love sitting at the bar.  Staff is super friendly.  I've been here probably around 10 times (it's local) and only once has the food been a little sub-par - maybe the usual cooks were off?  Don't know, but 1 not so great meal out of 10 isn't bad.  I'll be back.  Many more times.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Duck tacos, white sangria, steak fajitas...and a shot of agave. All while luckily landing an immediate spot at the bar on a busy night. FTW.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Meh, sort of weird. I went in thinking it would be a mexican place. It's not really though. I mean I ended up getting a Hanger Steak and Flan ... Yeah interesting pair right? Well the steak was ok. A little tough and cut a little too thin for my liking. The service is nice. Our server was very kind and offered recommendations whenever he could and made sure we got what he thought would be the best of the menu. However I was a little underwhelmed. The flan was so so. It was good, but not too great. Anyways I think next time I am in the area I will check elsewhere first.
author: Greg G.

description:
This one gets 5 stars because I went 2 weeks ago and I'm still thinking about the rock cod burrito.  The fish was cooked just right and the burrito wasn't stuffed with a bunch of fillers.  That's all I had so I'll have to go back to try other things.  My friend got the duck tacos, but she had a bite of the burrito and said that was better.  This is the best burrito I've had in years.  The kogi burrito is great too, but a totally different flavor.

It was around $8 so not cheap, but worth it.  There isn't too much space for seating but not too bad.
author: Chuck P.

description: I was determined to try out the other items on the menu so I came back again for the 2nd time.  Had the pork & shrimp carne asada....My oh my, they were beyond-words delicious!  Both were so flavorful.  The pork was so tendered and well marinated and the shrimp was perfectly cooked.  Again, 5 stars over all!
author: elle n.

description: Small, cozy spot with good atmosphere and great food.  We had the vegetarian tacos, guacamole and black beans - all we very good.  My wife says her mango margarita was the best she's ever had (and that's sort of "her thing", so she knows a good one).  The flan really sealed it for us - amazing!  The waiter was great too - as friendly and attentive as you could ask for.  It was our first time there but will definitely be going back.
author: Ed H.

description:
Great Mexican food with a French sensibility (in the best possible way ;)

Excellent quality, great flavors, portions are smallish, which I appreciate (especially in Mexican food, which IMHO usually goes over the top)
author: Seth B.

description: This place is not only SUPER delicious, the staff is fantastic as well. I had carne asada, and steak tacos with the roasted corn. Needless to say, the combo was the best I've had. They serve alcohol too, and to keep it Mexican, I got a dos equis. Again, real good food, great service, and ORGANIC! At a great price!!
author: Veasna L.

description: Clean, quality burrito place... but its no papalote
author: Gracie L.

description: Everything I have tried at this place is delicious.  I have to say the shrimp tempura burrito is incredible.  The restaurant is small though and it fills up quickly.
author: Dawn R.

description:
Decided to head to the city as a family today for lunch and a Holiday visit to Union Square.  But the question of where to eat was nagging us.  Do we go somewhere we already know or try something new??

A Yelp search narrowed us down to a few options that seemed to make sense.  So Off to Papito's we went.

Came up from the mid-peninsula...was easy to find, right off of 280N.....and waa laa...there was parking all over the place.  WOW!!!  This has to be a good sign?

Yes...it was a great sign...because all four of us thoroughly enjoyed lunch at Papito's.

3 of us had the taco dishes...although a variety of different ones.  I had the pork and the fried chicken tacos.  WOW....they were both great, but the Fried Chicken taco was SUPERB!!!!  I can't forget to mention that we had the guacamole and grilled corn as appetizers.  The guac was great....very fresh and tasty.....but let me tell ya....the Grilled Corn....WOW!!!  We ordered one small dish of the corn...which normally has two pieces....our waiter was great and took it upon himself to bring it cut into 4 pieces instead.  Even my daughter who doesn't like corn on the cob...absolutely loved it.  WOW!!!

So.....we will be back.  This is a great place....food was superb.and the service was excellent.  It's small....but we were there on a weekday around 1:30pm...and there was no problem getting a table.

This is a nice area with several other good restaurant choices nearby in case Papito's is packed.

Thanks!!  A great lunch!
author: K F.

description:
HUGE RIPOFF!
Seriously??  I find it hard to understand how some people can rave about this place.
 
It is extremely OVERPRICED, has ridicuously SMALL PORTIONS, and the food itself is BLAND AND TASTELESS - and all those fancy toppings mentioned  in such detail in the menu are NOWHERE to be found on the food! 

$7 for a regular burrito that in fact was the size of what every other place calls a "Baby Burrito" and should sell for about $4.50. The bulk of the burritto was taken up by the 2 ends of chewy, mushy rolled up Tortilla....and the FLAVOR was MISSING IN ACTION. The two bites of meat in mine were average in taste (certainly not as good as my fav mexican spots), the 6 or 7 black beans in it seemed lonely and confused as they wondered where all their brothers and sisters had disappeared to, and the Spanish Rice must have had a dispute with the French owners and run away, because it was simply non-existant.  

Two Tacos for $8 - small street tacos that should sell for about $4 bucks max. We had the Duck, which I had to try because that's the one I heard everyone talking about, which turned out to be some sort of stewed mystery meat that tasted sort of like pork, but not quite.  No rice or beans at all, and once again, where were all those exotic sounding toppings? All I could discern were a few limp shavings of red cabbage.

3 small plastic containers with a stingy bare bit in the bottom of each
one that contained some thin runny faux surrogates for real salsa.

A very small cardboard carton of chips that were on a par to what you can buy in a big bag on sale at the grocery store.

Oh well - at least we are still gifted with lots of places in SF for great, inexpensive and authentic mexican food.  I'd advise you don't waste your money at this place and go patronize them.
author: Auntie M.

description: Awesome food! Great tacos (fish + carne asada) + hot salsa. Watermelon fresca is ok. Service is great.
author: Tuhin S.

description:
The food is fine but it's not really a Mexican restaurant.  I had hoped it was going to be a taco shop when they were building it because there's not another one in easy walking distance.  Bummer.

It ended up being a kind of French-Mexican fusion, super trendy, kinda artsy, pretty snooty and way overpriced.  

Unusual menu items like lamb tacos and stuff, but generally overpriced for a tiny, uncomfortable Mexican place.  My food was good, but it's just too packed in, too expensive, and too pretentious to be better than three stars.
author: Scott B.

description: A very nice place for lunch if you are in the Potrero Hill area.  Prices are pretty reasonable [$7 burrito, `$10 enchiladas] with a lot of options.  The soup was great and the duck burrito was delicious.  I will definitely be going back.
author: Alured P.

description: I went here with girlfriends for a late lunch/early dinner. We ordered a pitcher of sangria, had guacamole and chips with three salsa (very tasty). We also ordered the special; squash blossom quesadilla (very good). The corn on the cob was good too.
author: Pam E.

description: Cute place. Great location. Organic ingredients.  You pay a little extra here for high quality mexican food.  Only reason I gave 3 stars was that the meat in my pastor taco was undercooked.  The beer batter baja fish taco was bomb.
author: Damien F.

description: Yes, it's mexican - but it's really French. Fantastic blend. Very casual and inexpensive - but YUMMMMMM. Duck tacos - check. Fried fish tacos - I'll take 12 NOW. Fantastic.
author: Victor Z.

description:
Had dinner here with a friend on a Friday and sat at the bar.  I'm new to town so the connection with Chez Maman, etc. is lost on me.  But people do swear that this is meaningful!

The host/manager is French and very friendly guy.  They don't have a liquor license (beer/wine only), but notwithstanding they do a decent agave liqueur margarita that was nice on a warm evening.  See, I have a hard time having Mexican dinner without a tequila-based beverage ....  We shared a tomato/cactus salad that was really good and fresh.   I had a 'bajataco' (fried cod) and a taco carnitas.  Both were very tasty and at 2 for $9, a relatively good deal.  To finish, freshly baked cookies with atole and me, having a sweet tooth, I was thrilled!  It's very popular and very small so I'd go early.  It's a lengthy bus trip for me but I would totally go back again.  And soon!
author: Laura H.

description: Recommend the Baja Fish Taco and the Camaron Casteño Taco (Spicy Shrimp).
author: Michelle Y.

description:
I have been excited to try this restaurant since the sign went up on the outside of the building a couple of months ago. Today I stopped in for a late lunch. There are about 6 two top tables inside with an additional 6-8 seats at the bar and 4 additional tables out front.  The decor is very bright and happy in Lime and Yellows with copper accents. I ordered the two tacos for 8$ (one bajataco and one chorizo) and a Mexican Coca-Cola.  I was going to order the carnitas but unfortunately the were out of that and the duck (it was a late lunch so I can't fault them especially on their first week). The fish taco was AMAZING.  The flavors were a true delight on my tongue. I think I could eat them everyday. The chorizo wasn't bad, but after being wowed by the fish taco, the chorizo didn't stand a chance.   The food from my first experience gets a 5. The area needed a good taqueria. I cant speak to the noise level as there were only about 6 people inside while I was eating. It's hard surfaces so I would assume when it fills up, it's going to get a little hard to hear as the tables are less than 6" away from one another.  The reason I gave it 4 stars, for my two tacos and bottle of Mexican Coca-Cola was just shy of $13. After tip it's over 15$.  You are getting table service and the food is better than a standard taqueria but the prices seem just a bit on the hefty side. 
All said, you should definitely check it out.
author: Scott S.

description:
THE WORST!  I am so disappointed, I was hoping for a good neighbor Mexican taqueria and instead we got an over priced, poor service, horribly bland "Mexican styled" restaurant.  

How can you screw up guacamole?  

Mexican food should be simple, fresh and delicious... they need to work on all three.
author: Michelle A.

description: did a walk in to go burrito, food was just ok. Huge negative environment with the French Lady behind the counter bitching at some French man that was sitting at the counter, shoving food in the mouth and bitching back, was not what I wanted to listen to while waiting for my food.
author: Bin M.

description: Papito is from the team from Chez Papa.  My meal started out great with a simple nopales salad with refreshing citrus.  Unfortunately, the rest of the meal was decent but it had so much potential.  I was hoping they would get more inventive and do a French Mexican fusion.
author: Monica L.

description: Papito, welcome to Potrero Hill. I know your (Chez) Mama and Papa for a while, you know, and I'm really looking forward to getting to know you, and your lighter-than-air baja tacos and tacos papitos are a fresh and inspired start to paving that road! I can't wait to come back and peruse your menu once again...until then, I will rest in a blissful, light, and satisfying food coma.
author: louise z.

description: The food is amazing. The service is way below par. Papito, the main guy thinks that he has so much business he can just be a d!ck to any body but locals. His brother on the other hand is a gentleman. Papito has ignored me multiple times. Informed me that single orders should be done in store not over the phone, because they can make them so quickly. After two attempts at that, and 30 min of waiting each time, I will be calling in my orders from now on. Also there is someone there that orders duck and a glass of wine. If he gets there before you, Papito will kiss his ass and pretend like you dont exist. Turns out he was served "not duck" several times.  If you want a good dinner, get take out. This place has service about as welcoming as a private tennis club.
author: Sam I.

description:
As a Potrero Hill resident, I decided to give this new joint a try last night. Yes, there's a line but the wait wasn't all that long at 7:30. It seems like they turn the table quite quickly. 

As some of the reviews mentioned it's a Mexican restaurant by way of France. It looks like it's the same operator who runs Chez Papa and Chez Mama hence the influence on the food.

The food is a hardy-size with great tasting blend of mexican ingredients and french flare in presentation and flavors. We had the beef and duck quesadilla with tamarind aqua fresca. 

Nice buzz about the place. Will be back.
author: Clement P.

description: ONE OF TH E BEST ON POTRERO HILL. Our new little Mexican Restaurant is one of our favorites for tasty food. A simple but charming little menu as they always have new things to try. Great food, great service and people from the wati staff to the cooks to the owner. Love this place and highly recommend the choice of (3) taco dish and sangria. You won't be dissappointed from every angle.
author: Johnny D.

description: While the grub here is interesting and flavorful, they've allowed the quality of the food (and service) to slip some. The chips and salsa are yummy and some of the dishes (including fried chicken tacos and duck quesadillas) are 'different.' Just wish they had something to excite the chef and revitalize the menu.
author: Denise N.

description: Best vegetarian tacos. Flavorful gourmet taste. Loved the smokiness of peppers. Also, the nicest and friendliest owner. Our new local restaurant.
author: Sumeera R.

description: seriously good [creative] burritos. yeah, carne asada burritos are nice, but duck? fried chicken?!
author: Darin A.

description:
"Woohoo!  As good as it gets!"

I love this place.  I came here twice in two days;  the first time with my g/f to kill an hour before a show at Bottom of the Hill, and then two days later to celebrate her bro's bday.

Basics first:  they have street parking, room for maybe 20-24 customers indoors (7 at the bar,  six 2-person tables that can be pushed together).  There are 3-4 outdoor tables.  Beer and wine for sure, an agave tequila, and I don't know if there's more alcohol beyond that. 

My first visit was on a Friday night.  We were looking for a quick bite.  The place was packed, but it had good energy: lively convo, orange and red interiors with the rainy dark outside had everyone in the place very happy to be indoors.  There weren't seats immediately available, so we gladly stood inside and sipped on Sangria to get us started.  That was delicious!  I've never heard of white sangria, so we had the red (we had the white on Sunday night).   Very yummy, and dangerous if you like sweet and don't pay attention.
 
When a table finally opened up 10 minutes later, we order tacos:  the Carnitas de Pato (duck confit carnitas, pickles, mint, tamarind sauce) and Pollo Empanizado (breaded fried chicken, chipotle remoulade, salsa roja, guacamole, pico de gallo, purple cabbage slaw, crème fraiche).  So, so, so tasty, especially the crème fraiche.  Two tacos run for $8.00/which I think were well worth the value for the flavors involved.  My girlfriend got the (Chicken) Enchiladas Rojas (three? enchiladas, red sauce, crème fraiche, cheese.  Those come in pork, too.  I didn't think those were as good for the $13.

We also got guacamole and chips.  The guac was delicious, came out very fast, and beautifully presented.   In fact, all of our food came out within 5 minutes of ordering.  Because the interior is so intimate, they were good about attending to our table without hovering or coming back too often.

On our Sunday trip, our party had five to start, and two more arrived an hour later.  They did a great job of juggling our needs (7 people sitting together) while juggling theirs.   The food was as excellent as the Friday before,  and they were super, super cheerful the whole time without making us rushed or embarrassed to take up the whole bar.

* * *
Go there if you're down for some Mexican cuisine that isn't just a super burrito (which they do have, BTW) in a classy environment that you doesn't require you to be classy.  If you're willing to try new combinations (tamarind, pineapple, duck), you'll be in for a treat.  And if you like a staff that is cheerful and remembers you, you'll definitely have a good time. 

I'll be back for sure.
author: Chris G.

description: Had the ceviche and it was really really really good.  I mean I've eaten at La Mar and now really don't get what the buzz is about La Mar.  Salsas were also excellent.  Just wish it was bigger so I could feel better about going to dinner and not wondering if I'm going to have to wait.
author: Brian H.

description: this place is always busy! and for good reason. its fresh and filling but not greasy. you will feel full and satisfied after eating here, but not stuffed. we love this place. i reccommend the duck confit burrito. its amazing.
author: Mellissa B.

description: I was very medium on this place.  Ambience is lovely, shrimp taco was my favorite thing on the menu.  Had the mushroom quesadilla which was pretty good but soooooo filling.  Sangria was ok too, but for the prices I wanted it all to be stellar!
author: Jill C.

description:
Great addition to the hill 
Super service and great atmosphere
good $$$ too !

cheers Joslyn!!!
author: James C.

description: AMAZING! I love Nopalito and Regalito but this has just displaced both of them as my go-to restaurant! Such amazing micheladas and tacos that we ordered another round despite being full! So yummy!!
author: glynis d.

description: Yum, yum, yum. I've had a few different burritos from Papito. All are good, the fried chicken burrito is AMAZING! Very very tasty food and kind service...highly recommended. I have never dined in (the restaurant is very small) but every time I go in to pick up food, its very cute and has comfy bar seats!
author: Megan N.

description: I ate here for the first time the other night and it was great. My husband had eaten here a few times before and kept telling me how good it was. He was right. We sat outside with our stroller and I ordered a chorizo quesadilla and he ordered the shrimp quesadilla. They were both so good and the service was friendly and attentive as well. I am excited to eat there again, maybe this week.
author: Courtney M.

description: meh... Mexican food interpreted by French palates translates as bland and overpriced.  Probably wouldn't go back.
author: Davina C.

description: Love me some fajitas and I think these were my fave ever (steak) the jalapeño marinade give them a delightful kick
author: John Q.

description:
Just finished lunch with a client at this restaurant, which I have eaten at many times before, as a resident of Potrero Hill. The food was delicious today, as it has been on all previous visits. Unfortunately, the service was not! 

We were given water and utensils upon siting down and our order was taken in a timely manner. The food came to the table in a reasonable amount of time, but that was the end of the service. After finishing our meal we sat unattended for at least 15 minutes. Finally I got up to find someone to give us the bill and encountered a man, not our waiter, who I believe is one of the owners, or at the least the manager. When I requested the bill and told him we had been waiting for some time, he said it appeared we were not finished with our lunch. His comment was delivered with such a large dose of attitude that it took me by surprise. He really did not care, or take the time, to ask what our experience had been.

This is the first time I've encountered any attitude or unfriendliness at this restaurant, but I left with a very sour taste in my mouth, in spite of how good the food was. Adding insult to injury I believe it came from someone in charge of the restaurant. I find this to be in very bad form.
author: Jay T.

description: Great organic, natural food! Best thing is a glass of cava, with the papito salad and their beef tacos at their OUTDOOR SEATING at end of day or for lunch. Hard to find that in SF.
author: Billy P.

description: Yay. Finally. Some really good Mexican food in SF.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Unbelievably delicious, but slightly disappointing in price... ($4/taco is a bit steep compared to its direct competitors of tacolicious - which I deem to be in a more expensive area - and the taco shop at Underdog's less of a competitor, but has great fish tacos)... 

Anyways, great fish tacos, shrimp ala plancha tacos.. to a lesser extent liked the duck carnitas tacos (slightly on the sweet side) and the carne asada. REALLY WANTED to have dessert but had no room. Oh, and I do recommend the shrimp ceviche.. very fresh + delicious!
author: Jeannette L.

description: Great ambiance, lighting and service at this small yet friendly place .  Overall excellent food.  Those cheesy corn appetizers are to die for.  Great prices.
author: Charith W.

description: best duck tacos ever!   and even though I hate guacamole, I have heard that it is the best guac around.  fabulous people, amazing food
author: Barbara W.

description: The Hill is complete now that Papito has finally opened it's doors. They are still brand new so ignore bad reviews for wait times etc. The alcohol is coming soon too. Run my the Chez Papa/Maman crew, they are brilliant at what they do. The menu is Mexican with French twists here and there and the food is to die for. Can't wait to go back and they are also gonna do weekend brunch with a different menu. I've been waiting for them to the open the doors for ages and now I'm oh so happy. Burrito's on my doorstep, yes please.
author: Joanna R.

description: "Little place big heart" is SPOT ON! It's such a comfortable little watering hole. Absolutely loved how laid back and personal the entire experience was. The food was some of the best mexican I've had! Their salsa verde is YUMMM! The chorizo quesadilla was a big hit. The Churros were alright.. but maybe I'm not a big fan of Churros.
author: S R.

description: The food is great.  First, they start you with chips and 3 difference dipping sauces.  Since I'm not a fan of spicy sauces, I was relieved that all 3 sauces were not spicy.  The tacos are amazing.   I ordered the Carnitas De Pato (roast duck) and Camaron Costeño (sauteed shrimp).   It gets quite messy eating tacos but it was great having so much food piled up.  Additionally, Papitos has fresh watermelon juice.  It was a perfect complement to the tacos.
author: Rose C.

description: Food is great.  The bar tender Oliver is the best.
author: Jed K.

description:
Excellent Mexican food with a French twist! 

I love Mexican food but far to often the quality and variety of ingredients is lacking at Mexican restaurants. Papito blends great priced Mexican food with high quality ingredients and a charming manager. What more can be said?
author: Daire H.

description: Good news ... For those that couldn't get a to-go before, can now! I dropped in late last night to grab a burrito, it was fast & tasty!
author: Jo D.

description: Nouvelle Cuisine French style Mexican restaurant, only the help and the name are Mexican. Disappointing, even more so when prices are high and service is lousy.  After several months of operation, one could have hoped for better.  Will they ever find the magic of some (but not all) of their other places? I doubt it.   I will go elsewhere.
author: Ralph A.

description:
Every once in a while, you have an experience at a restaurant that is so aggrevating, so miserable, so "I so f*cking wish they would close TOMORROW!!!", that you swear off eating out for ever and ever and ever (I mean at a restaurant fool, get your mind out of the gutter!). That restaurant, amigos, is Papito. 

Unfortunately, this lovely thing called Yelp does not allow one to give negative stars. Because this sh*thole would get a negative 5 stars and then some. Here's the rundown. After checking out Muni Diaries Live at the Make Out Room (awesome time, by the way), my slightly enebriated wife decided that she wanted to check out Papito. She read their review online from SF Weekly and was drunkenly fiending for something called the "JJJ". We checked Papito's website, and it says they are open until 11pm on Fridays. Despite my Taqueria Cancun-fueled objections, we hailed a cab on Valencia & 22nd and headed for Papito. Total cost of the cab ride, including tip: $10.

So we walk in the door at 10pm on the dot, and the bar is about 75% full. So we ask to sit down, and were rudely told "Sorry, we're closed". My wife attempted to explain that we had just wasted $10 on a cab ride from the Mission, but the jerkoff bartender (owner?) wouldn't budge. I pulled up their website on my phone and tried (soberly!) explaining that their site specifically indicated that they served until 11pm, at which point this utter and complete assh*le physically escorted us out of the restaurant! In his broken English, he tried steering us to their other place, Chez Maman, saying "its the best restaurant in the neighborhood and it's not expensive". EXCUSE ME?!? You don't have the foresight to update your f*cking website so that people wouldn't trek from all over SF to come to your restaurant, and then you insult your customers in addition? If I wanted f*cking French food, I woudln't have pissed away $10 on a cab when Cafe Des Amis is right down the street from my g*damned house! This d*ckhead can kiss my arse, he has no business running a restaurant in San Francisco!

Disgusted, we jumped on the Double-Deuce and went home hungry, our Friday night completely ruined by this douche-nozzle. Please, don't waste your time or your money on this dump, go somewhere (anywhere!) else instead!!!
author: Michael T.

description: Nice surprise; best tacos in town.  Great, friendly service.
author: Sharky T.

description: Came here for lunch. It was very small inside and the menu was very ordinary so I really didnt expect much from my meal. I ordered the fish, I think it was the Rainbow Trout dish with mango salsa? I didnt want to get anything messy like the Quesadilla where i would have to use my hands. I was really pleasantly surprised at the all the flavors in this dish. It came with a very nice mango salsa and a bed of rice with some gravy. The gravy was on the sweet side, which i didnt expect but it was different. I would have preferred it be more on the savory side but i enjoyed it with the fish which was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The texture on the fish felt like almost like i was eating a chilean seabass. It was so buttery and flaky at the same time. I cleaned everything off my plate, something I hardly ever do. The chips and three different salsa dipping sauces were really good too and free:)
author: Ravenous T.

description: I'm glad there's another restaurant but for burritos I'd go elsewhere. Dos PInyas down the road and plenty of places in the Mission. I get it French styled burritos. (by mexicans in the kitchen). Pay the premium for that.
author: Lu R.

description: service was shitty (like getting served by a frat bro) but the food was actually very good. enmolada was ok, but everything else (carnitas tacos especially) was great.
author: Sahil L.

description: The owner of Papito did write to me with an apology and offer to 'make-up' my last time at his restaurant. That alone is appreciated and will make it back to Papito soon for a second chance. I still don't think I would order the fish tacos, but try other items
author: Chris P.

description: I've tried their brunch, weekday lunch and dinner multiple times. One of the best Mexican places in the city, though their salsa bar could use some improvement. The housemade guacamole more than makes up for it though. I like their breakfast burritos the best.
author: demaws o.

description: New to the Potrero neighborhood and we've been trying out all of the restaurants... and as of today, I can say this was our FAVORITE!  She had carne asada steak tacos and they were fantastic!  The meat was excellent.  I had the chicken quesadillas and they too were out of this world!  They also serve mexican beer complete with salted rims, lime, and on ice....  perfect compliment to our meals.  Overall, I'd say we have to give this place four thumbs up!
author: Mac K.

description: My husband and I had dinner here one rainy night, and what a delicious, satisfying meal it was!  We started out with the elote asado (tasty corn on the cob, cooked perfectly, with some mighty scrumptious toppings), and then I had the vegetarian tacos, which were wonderful.  My husband had the quesadilla papa con chorizo, which he really enjoyed - he gave me some of the potatoes from his quesadilla, and they were like butter - perfectly cooked, and very fresh.  We will be back, and we will be bringing friends next time!
author: Heather C.

description: I purposely don't go grocery shopping so that I have another reason to walk over here for dinner with my boyfriend.  The tacos are packed full of flavor.  The papa con chorizo taco is my absolute favorite, but I also recommend trying the enchiladas rojas.  It's nice to sit outside on a sunny day, but when it gets dark, it's warm and cozy inside.  I like that this place is small; it's intimate.  The food will make you forget everyone sitting around you - even the person you came with!
author: Jen O.

description:
After recently moving to the neighbourhood and wondering such things as - how does the Muni bus get up these hills, where is the easiest grade hill if I'm walking along with - do I need to go to the Mission if I want a taste of Mexican? I come across Papito.

Firstly, let me say if you are looking for that Mexican hole in the wall feeling with huge plates that leave you in a wonderful food coma for hours - this is not your place.

However if you want fresh ingredients, a quirky take on Mexican, wonderful flavours and attentive service give it a try.

I sat at the bar since husband was not in tow. Asked for an Argentinian Malbec and was asked if I'd like to try a couple of tastings which I did and then I picked the Spanish wine. The tastings were generous BTW.

Chips arrived with a tray of 3 types of dip. Mild green, a sweeter one (not to my taste) and spicy salsa. Yum.

I'm not a vegetarian but ordered the mushroom quesidilla which was filled with wild mushrooms. herbs, cheese and served with guac and fresh tomato salsa. Very yummy & so huge I took half of it home.

After I paid the manger (owner) offered me "one for the road" an agave wine they don't sell but he keeps in. Also very yum. 

I felt welcomed, looked after, fed well and will definitely be back. 

Plus as has been mentioned - the GM/owner is very easy on the eye and with an accent to die for! :-)
author: D M.

description: I love this place so much. Awesome food, chill waiters. It's just fun to come by here. My favorite is the hamburguesa with chorizo and the duck quesadilla.
author: Evie M.

description: Best mexican in town. Wonderful service and atmosphere.
author: Nick S.

description: Love going to this spot for lunch!! Amazing little gem on the corner of Connecticut and 18th. Although relatively small they serve up big flavors! You can't go wrong here, and you absolutely have to try the sopa ranchera! It's one of my all time favs!
author: Anisha W.

description: Just had take out from Papito today.  I ordered the duck confit quesadilla and carne asada quesadilla.  Both were delicious and made quickly (in about 10 minutes.) This corner of Potrero Hill has a couple excellent French restaurants (Chez Papa Bistrot and Chez Maman) and this is clearly French style Mexican. So do not expect any real heat or classic Mexican flavor. Do expect tender stewed meat, caramelized onions, carottes râpées and crème fraiche in your Mexican named dish. If you just want a cheap taco, head to Gaby and Liz taco truck at Jackson Park. Papito is unique and more upscale.
author: Edmund W.

description:
$12  burrito and not open for lunch? Was eagerly anticipating the opening of Papito - thought lunch last Friday would be the perfect time to give it a try - only to walk in and be told they don't open until 5:30. What am I to do? Easy, walk across the street and enjoy a wonderful bowl of pho at Sunflower as I watch group after group exit Papito as annoyed and disappointed as I was.

To the owners - you guys are responsible for amazing restaurants such as Chez Maman, Papa and until recently (huge disappointment for selling it btw) Pizza Nostra. You guys know better than this, rookie mistake. 

I have no doubt the food will be good and for $12 it better be but until they open for lunch I will continue to enjoy a great bowl of pho at Sunflower or a slice of pizza at Goat Hill.
author: Erika P.

description: 25 years in Potrero Hill will teach you how to deal with an excess of attitude, and the owner/head waiter has too much of it. Here's some advice from your neighbors: be patient with customers (even when_they_aren't); don't lecture them about dirty tables; greet them within 60 seconds of seating; and take the order within 10 minutes. The food can be good but it also can be uneven. We give our local haunts three tries before setting a score. Three strikes for Papitos!
author: C S.

description: Went for a late lunch a few weeks back. Cute place. Great salsas. Yummy mex food with fresh ingredients. Very friendly staff.
author: Vidya R.

description: Really good. Perfect, in fact!  Delicious as well as generous portions and priced well. You wouldn't think of trying their flan, but even that was amazing!
author: Elaine k.

description: Really, really great. Prices are high, but ingredients are always fresh, organic, and delicious. Love the red wine sangria. Friendly staff is always ready to make me feel at home. Burritos are so big you can take half home for a second meal. Truly a neighborhood gem!
author: Geae D.

description: This is one of my favorite spots to eat. It's organic great location. Yumm.   10 star if they had  the option.
author: bennet m.

description:
I think a little overwhelmed by the response in the first week, but they adapted well. Yes I ate there twice for dinner, and once for lunch, and yes I am a local.
This is not just your neighborhood taqueria, the food is a step above that. I loved the duck taco and chorizo taco I had the first time. And the mexican flan to follow was sublime.
By the third visit the kitchen was running like a well oiled machine - turning out take out orders rapid fire, while not interfering with the food going to the tables.
This is definitely a mexican Chez Maman, and I can see myself going there a lot.
Yes it is possible to order lots of things and then suddenly be surprised by the bill, but this happens wherever you go. My two tacos were excellent and I dont think too expensive at $8, so the whiners should just keep driving to the Mission, struggle with parking, and save a buck or two at the same old places.
Me, I will park easily on the hill, and enjoy excellent service and food. Oh, and the agua fresca - try the watermelon.
This is a must visit place....
author: Don R.

description: i loved this place...fresh, smartly prepared mexican food and amazing drinks...try "el diabolito"....beer, bloody mary mix, agave liquer....might sound odd but its delicious
author: Neil Z.

description: I am still eating my burrito.  It is delicious.  I am looking forward to trying more.  I ordered the carne asada super burrito.  I phoned in my order and they had it waiting for me when I arrived about 15 minutes later.  Wow, its really good.  I can see myself eating here weekly.  The burrito is actually very large.  They gave me three different small containers of salsa, one red hot one that is ok, a mango or fruit one that is interesting, and a tomatillo salsa that I haven't opened yet bc that would slow me down from eating this burrito. Ok, I tried it, it is roasted tomatillo salsa and it is delicious.  They also included a small container of chips.
author: Oren B.

description: great mexican restaurant the more i go the better the food gets there new soup on the menu is called sopa ranchera. OHH MY GOD TO DIE FOR.Great soup for cold night at the hill.
author: rey m.

description: Came here for lunch and enjoyed it.  It's better than "A-OK" but if Yelp ever implements that half star system, I'd give this place 3.5 stars.  The food here was quite good quality and very, very fresh.  The chips and salsa were quite good.  I had the carnitas burrito, my dad the chorizo burrito and my mom the hamburgesa.  The hamburgesa is actually quite delicious.  My carnitas burrito had wonderfully tender pork and was not greasy as you get with some versions of carnitas.  That said, it seemed to be lacking some of the spicy kick that i've come to expect from Mexican food.  All in all though, I think I'll be coming back.
author: Sean G.

description: POOR SERVICE! Will keep it short, here's the facts: Went here for a business lunch meeting. Due to food allergies (dairy) didn't order the fish tacos battered in butter. My coworkers ordered various plates and I just dabbled in some snacks out of my purse. The waitress named Ayele with long curly hair rudely exclaimed "there must be something you can order!" Chewbacca then went on to inform me that they will never allow me to come in again with food and proceeded to ignore our party throughout the course of the meal. Embarrassing for me, but more so for her and the restaurant she represents. She could have handled in a more adult fashion. 1 Star
author: D M.

description: the steak tacos and the guacamole are sooooooo good.  the shrimp tacos are killer too.  quesadillas...yummm.  basically, everything i've had here has been really, really good.  i'm so glad they're just right up the big giant hill.  :)
author: Emily T.

description: Yum.  Best reasonably-priced restaurant on the hill.  And to think it used to be an overpriced shoe store!  The agua fresca is divine; the guacamole with quesa fresca (spelling?) is addictive.  I love the tacos, and the waitstaff are sweet.  We come here as often as we can afford.
author: Beth F.

description: Good food. Friendly service. I was a happy camper. I'll go back.
author: Allison D.

description: Not only is the food made from incredibly high quality ingredients (and all organic, too!) but the flavor combinations are incredible. Every single taco on the menu is an oralgasm. I sometimes just wave my finger in the air and order whatever I touch down on, since I haven't discovered a single item on their menu that wasn't incredible. Sometimes Mexican food can be bland, overcooked rice and beans-- never the case here. It is fresh and exciting. The prices are high, but you get a lot of food for your money and I always leave very satisfied. Try the raspberry margaritas for a real treat.
author: Geae D.

description: This is really good Mexican food.  It really surprised me because Mexican food tends to taste the same at most locations.  But somehow they have added an extra twist to it which makes us want to go back.  The servers are very attentive. It is a small restaurant and can get noisy, but we've found it to be an enjoyable experience.  It fits well into the Potrero Hill neighborhood along with the other excellent restaurants on 18th Street. Definitely worth a try.
author: Steve H.

description: Nice cute place. The food was great. Was served quickly. The quesadillas were awesome. Huge portion size and very tasty.  The guacamole is a must have!
author: Deepti P.

description: Papito has great, high-end food in a purposefully humble and uncomplicated space.  (This seems to be the Potrero trend.)  The fish tacos in particular were really tasty.  The cactus salad was a little slimy for my taste, but that may be unavoidable.  They've done decent take-out for us, but I prefer to eat there because the counter is a great dining spot and the staff is really nice.  I'll agree with at least one reviewer who points out that neither the owners nor the food are really Mexican, which was fine with me as long as the food was good.
author: David B.

description: Ugh.. Taco chips were stale. Chicken was cold and overdone. Tacos were horrible. What happened to this place? Was so good.
author: Beth T.

description:
I just had dinner at this place again yesterday. It's my second time in a month. Again it was  a delightful experience and I met people at the bar and talked about the Giants winning the division and heading to the playoffs after a long drought.
I decided to write this review after I read the previous reviews that are not necessarily factual. Any person who take their own food to a restaurant is abhorrent, disrespectful and totally primitive. They should go to a park and have a picnic.
This is a unique restaurant that offers succulent Mexican French inspired dishes. Tthe chef and the kitchen staff are Mexicans who have taken the Mexican food experience to another level that I find true only to San Francisco culinary heaven.
It's a small place with a great atmosphere and the personnel are friendly, attentive immediately and hospitable. Potrero Hill locals line up the street to wait for a table.
I recommend that anyone who likes Mexican food to try this place on their own and experience it regardless of any review. I highly recommend Papito's and will go back in a heart beat!
author: Keith D.

description: We (2 people) went on a Friday evening at 6pm and were immediately seated at the bar. Had the watermelon aqua fresca which was sweet and refreshing. For dinner: super burrito with chicken, best burrito I've ever had. Flaky, tender tortilla, flavorful, and fresh. Wife had the chicken quesadilla, delicious guacamole and again very fresh ingredients. All the dishes coming out of the kitchen also looked delicious. Can't wait to go back.
author: Tim S.

description: really friendly service and great food!  camaron costeno quesadilla is my fave.
author: K B.

description: bad tortillas. it starts and stops there. you can have all the organic produce you want but fix the tortillas.
author: thad b.
